original: Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā a sārammaṇam ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: With a sense-object as condition, a sense-object-dependent state arises, a root-cause condition: with one of the aggregates as object the three aggregates … with two of the aggregates as object the two aggregates … at the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—sārammaṇe khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—sārammaṇaṁ
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā a sārammaṇe khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā a sārammaṇa
translated: With a sense-object as condition, a non-sense-object-dependent state arises, a root-cause condition: with the sense-object aggregates as condition, materiality originated by consciousness; at the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe…
analyzed: ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe
translated: With a sense-object as condition, a sense-object-dependent state and a non-sense-object-dependent state arise, a root-cause condition: with one of the aggregates as object the three aggregates and materiality originated by consciousness … with two of the aggregates as object the two aggregates and materiality originated by consciousness …

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: at the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Anārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… mahābhūte paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūte paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpam
translated: With a non-object dhamma as condition, a non-object dhamma arises, by way of root-cause condition: One of the great essentials … With the great essentials as condition, the form that is derived from the great essentials, the form that is bodily-form, the form that is derived-form.

original: Anārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca sārammaṇā khandhā.🔽Anārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammo uppajjanti hetupaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca sārammaṇā khandhā, mahābhūte paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ.
analyzed: anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthum paṭicca sa ārammaṇāḥ khandhāḥ  anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammo uppajjanti hetu paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca sa ārammaṇāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa
translated: With a non-object dhamma as condition, an object-possessing dhamma arises, by way of root-cause condition: At the time of rebirth-linking, with the physical basis as condition, the object-possessing aggregates.🔽With a non-object dhamma as condition, an object-possessing dhamma and a non-object dhamma arise, by way of root-cause condition: At the time of rebirth-linking, with the physical basis as condition, the object-possessing aggregates and the form that is derived-form.

original: Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam ca anārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: With an object-possessing and a non-object dhamma as condition, an object-possessing dhamma arises, by way of root-cause condition: At the time of rebirth-linking,

original: sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe….
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca pe
translated: with one of the object-possessing aggregates and the physical basis as condition, three aggregates … with two of the object-possessing aggregates and the physical basis as condition, two aggregates …

original: Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—sārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti🔽hetupaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca tayo khandhā
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam ca anārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā a sārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe sa ārammaṇam ca anārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti  hetu paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe sa ārammaṇam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ
translated: With a factor having a cognitive object and a factor having no cognitive object as condition, a factor having no cognitive object arises, by way of root-cause condition: With the aggregates having a cognitive object and the great primaries as condition, the materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… sārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Ārammaṇa
analyzed: pe dve khandhe ca pe sa ārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa  ārammaṇa
translated: With a factor having a cognitive object and a factor having no cognitive object as condition, a factor having a cognitive object and a factor having no cognitive object arise, by way of root-cause condition: At the moment of rebirth-linking, with a single aggregate having a cognitive object and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates … With two aggregates … With the aggregates having a cognitive object and the great primaries as condition, the materiality of the physical heart- basis.🔽With a factor having a cognitive object and a factor having no cognitive object as condition, a factor having a cognitive object arises, by way of object condition: At the moment of rebirth-linking, with a single aggregate having a cognitive object and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates … With two aggregates … With the aggregates having a cognitive object and the great primaries as condition, the materiality of the physical heart-basis.

original: Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā— sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā sa ārammaṇam ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: With a factor having a cognitive object as condition, a factor having a cognitive object arises, by way of object condition: With a single aggregate having a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates … With two aggregates … At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Anārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā— paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca sārammaṇā khandhā.🔽Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca sa ārammaṇāḥ khandhāḥ  sa ārammaṇam ca anārammaṇam ca dhammam paṭicca sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  sa ārammaṇam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca pe
translated: With a non-object dhamma as condition, an object dhamma arises: at the moment of rebirth-linking, with the physical basis as condition, the object dhammas that are aggregates are the condition.🔽With an object dhamma and a non-object dhamma as condition, an object dhamma arises: at the moment of rebirth-linking,🔽with one object aggregate and the physical basis as condition, three aggregates … with two aggregates … (Abbreviated.)🔽

translated: With the object-having aggregates and the great primaries as condition, the form that is derived from the mind element arises. At the time of rebirth-linking, etc., …

original: Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti🔽nahetupaccayā—ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca

translated: With an object-having and without object as condition, a state with object and a state without object arise, that is, without condition of root cause.

analyzed: tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe sa ārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa  na ārammaṇa
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking, with an object-having aggregate and physical basis as condition, the three aggregates arise … with two aggregates and the physical basis as condition, the two aggregates arise. original: Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā— sārammaṇe khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….

translated: With an object-having state as condition, a state without object arises, that is, without condition of object. With the object-having aggregates as condition, the form that is derived from the mind element arises. At the time of rebirth-linking, etc., …

original: Anārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā. (Yāva asaññasattā.)

translated: With a non-object dhamma as condition, a non-object dhamma arises, not as object condition. (Up to) the non-percipient beings.

translated: In the non-cause section there are nine. In the non-object section there are three. In the non-dominance section there are nine. In the non-antecedent section there are three. In the non-conascence section there are three. In the non-concomitant section there are three. In the non-dependent section there are three. In the non-nutritive section there is one. In the non-faculty section there is one. In the non-path section there are two. In the non-association section there are three. In the non-dissociation section there are two. In the non-obstruction section there are three. In the non-deprivation section there are three.

translated: With respect to non-condition being cause, there are three in object, … in co-nascence, nine, … in the path, one, … in the un-included, nine.

translated: With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with a condition that is causally related and has no object, a causally related and has an object arises. original: Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paccayā anārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetuke
analyzed: sārammaṇam ca anārammaṇam ca dhammam paccayā anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuke
translated: With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the eye base as condition, the three aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the eye base as condition, two aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the body base as condition, the three aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the body base as condition, two aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the mind base as condition, the three aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the mind base as condition, two aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the mind-consciousness element as condition, the three aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the mind-consciousness element as condition, two aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the states that are causally related and have an object and arise together with the mind-consciousness element as condition, the three aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the states that are causally related and have an object and arise together with the mind-consciousness element as condition, two aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the states that are causally related and have an object and arise together with the mind-consciousness element as condition, and with the mind base as condition, the three aggregates do … With a condition that is causally related and has an object, and with the states that are causally related and have an object and arise together with the mind-consciousness element as condition, and with the mind base as condition, two

original: sārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: sa ārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: The kinds of resultant form that originate with intention and the great primaries that are its support condition. At the instant of rebirth-linking …

original: Sārammaṇañca anārammaṇañca dhammaṁ paccayā sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam ca anārammaṇam ca dhammam paccayā sa ārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti
translated: With a support and without a support as conditions, there arise states with a support and without a support.

original: nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā🔽…pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… ahetuke sārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ahetukam sa ārammaṇam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ  pe dve khandhe ca pe ahetuke sa ārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhāna
translated: With no condition as root cause: With one of the states with no root cause that have a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽… With two of the aggregates and materiality … With the aggregates that have no root cause that have a cognitive object and the four great primaries as condition, the kinds of derived materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽… With one of the states with no root cause that have a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe ahetukaṁ sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā🔽tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… ahetuke sārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā🔽kaṭattārūpaṁ …pe… (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe ahetukam sa ārammaṇam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā  tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe ahetuke sa ārammaṇe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā  kaṭattā rūpam saṅkhitta
translated: … With two of the aggregates and materiality … With the aggregates that have no root cause that have a cognitive object and the four great primaries as condition, the kinds of derived materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽… With one of the states with no root cause that have a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽… With two of the aggregates and materiality … With the aggregates that have no root cause that have a cognitive object and the four great primaries as condition, the kinds of derived materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽… With one of the states with no root cause that have a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽… With two of the aggregates and materiality … With the aggregates that have no root cause that have a cognitive object and the four great primaries as condition, the kinds of derived materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽… With one of the states with no root cause that have a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽… With two of the aggregates and materiality … With the aggregates that have no root cause that have a cognitive object and the four great primaries as condition, the kinds of derived materiality that originate with consciousness.🔽… With one of the states with no root cause that have a cognitive object as condition, the three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: … With two of the aggregates and materiality … With the aggregates that have no root cause that have a cognitive object and the four great primaries as condition, the kinds of derived materiality that originate with consciousness.

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: suddha 🔽na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: … With one of the states

original: tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, nakamme cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne cattāri,
analyzed: tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava na kamme cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne cattāri
translated: Three, not with the other three, three, not with support three, nine with prenascence, nine with postnascence, nine with nutriment,

original: namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: four with kamma, nine with result, one with the faculties, one with the jhāna, four with the path, nine with non-causality, three with non-result, two with non-restraint, three with non-causality, three with non-contention, three with non-enmity, three with non-violence, three with the undetermined.

original: 2.10.1.3.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: .... In the section on conditions in reverse order,

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava …pe… nakamme ekaṁ …pe… navippayutte ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava pe na kamme ekam pe na vippayutte eka
translated: With respect to conditions as root cause, there are three in object, nine in predominance, … in kamma there is one, … in non-restraint there is one. (In brief.)

original: 2.10.1.3.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: .... In the section on conditions in direct order,

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte nava …pe… magge tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte nava pe magge tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: With respect to conditions not as root cause, there are three in object, three in proximity, three in singleness, nine in conascence, … in the path there are three, … in the undetermined there are nine.

original: 2.10.1.4. Nissayavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāra
translated: .... The section on dependence

original: Nissayavāro paccayavārasadiso.🔽2.10.1.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāro paccaya vāra sadiso  sa saṭṭhavāra
translated: The section on dependence is similar to the section on conditions.🔽.... The section on association

original: 2.10.1.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: .... The section on conditions in direct order, etc.

original: Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— sārammaṇaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sa ārammaṇam ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhāḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: Conditioned by a condition that is a faculty, a condition that is a faculty arises: Conditioned by one of the aggregates that is a faculty, the three aggregates that are faculties arise … the two aggregates that are faculties arise. At the moment of rebirth-linking, conditioned by the heart-basis that is a faculty, the four aggregates that are faculties arise.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ (sabbattha ekaṁ), avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyāḥ eka ārammaṇe eka adhipatiyāḥ ekam sabbattha eka avigate eka
translated: In the section on root-cause, one factor is to be found in the root-cause condition, one in the object condition, one in the predominance condition, and one in the non-obstruction condition.

original: Anulomaṁ.🔽Sārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho sārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— ahetukaṁ sārammaṇaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate
analyzed: anuloma  sa ārammaṇam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam sa ārammaṇa  ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate
translated: In the section on the direct order,

original: khandhe saṁsaṭṭho vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ.
analyzed: khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho  na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ eka na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte eka
translated: Conditioned by a condition that is a faculty, a condition that is a mental concomitant arises: Conditioned by the one aggregate that is a faculty, the three aggregates that are mental concomitants arise. … Conditioned by the two aggregates that are faculties, the two aggregates that are mental concomitants arise. … Conditioned by the aggregates that are faculties and mental concomitants associated with doubt and with agitation, the delusion that is a mental concomitant associated with doubt and with agitation arises. (The rest in brief.)

original: Paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: In the section on the reverse order, one factor is to be found in the non-root-cause condition, one in the non-predominance condition, one in the non-pre-nascence condition, one in the non-post-nascence condition, one in the non-nutriment condition, one in the non-kamma condition, one in the non-result condition, one in the non-path condition, and one in the non-association condition.

original: 2.10.1.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: 2.10.1.6. Associated

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—sārammaṇā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ sa ārammaṇāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: A causally arisen phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for a causally arisen phenomenon. The causally arisen causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo anārammaṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—sārammaṇā hetū cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa ca anārammaṇassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—sārammaṇā
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ anārammaṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo sa ārammaṇāḥ hetū citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa ca anārammaṇassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo sārammaṇā
translated: A causally arisen phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for a non-causally arisen phenomenon. The causally arisen causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally arisen phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for a causally arisen phenomenon and for a non-causally arisen phenomenon. The causally arisen causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

analyzed: anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo anārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—sārammaṇādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ anārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati sa ārammaṇa adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, as conascence predominance condition and as object predominance condition. Having given a gift … having observed the Uposatha, he recollects that gift … that observance of the Uposatha, and on that account he becomes glad … and delight arises. Because of that delight, greed arises, a view arises, his past actions that have been done and accumulated with greed, hatred, and delusion come to growth, increase, and abundance. Having emerged from the attainment of the first jhāna, he recollects that attainment, and on that account he becomes glad … and delight arises. Because of that delight, greed arises, a view arises, his past actions that have been done and accumulated with greed, hatred, and delusion come to growth, increase, and abundance. Having emerged from the attainment of the second jhāna … from the attainment of the third jhāna … from the attainment of the fourth jhāna … from the attainment of the base of infinite space … from the attainment of the base of infinite consciousness … from the attainment of the base of nothingness … from the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception … from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, he recollects that attainment, and on that account he becomes glad … and delight arises. Because of that delight, greed arises, a view arises, his past actions that have been done and accumulated with greed, hatred, and delusion come to growth, increase, and abundance. Having emerged from the attainment of the first jhāna, he recollects the first jhāna, and on that account he becomes glad … and delight arises. Because of that delight, greed arises, a view arises, his past actions that have been done and accumulated with greed, hatred, and delusion come to growth, increase, and abundance. Having emerged from the attainment of the second jhāna … from the attainment of the third jhāna … from the attainment of the fourth jhāna … from the attainment of the base of infinite space … from the attainment of the base of infinite consciousness … from the attainment of the base of nothingness … from the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception … from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, he recollects the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, and on that account he becomes glad … and delight arises. Because of that delight, greed arises, a view arises, his past actions that have been done

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa ca anārammaṇassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa ca anārammaṇassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that has no cognitive object is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that has a cognitive object.🔽As object condition: Noble disciples recollect their virtue, recollect their generosity, recollect the deities, and recollect their own wholesome qualities.🔽They recollect the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha.🔽They recollect their own wholesome qualities.

original: Sahajātādhipati—sārammaṇādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati sa ārammaṇa adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: They recollect the wholesome qualities of others.🔽They recollect Nibbāna.

original: Anārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā
analyzed: anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati ariyā
translated: They review Nibbāna as peaceful, excellent, as the supreme among wholesome qualities.

original: nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti; nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa,🔽adhipatipaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa  adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthum garum katvā assādeti abhinandati
translated: They review Nibbāna as the destruction of craving, as the destruction of anger, as the destruction of delusion, as the destruction of defilements, as the destruction of knots, as the destruction of suffering.🔽They review Nibbāna as the destruction of the five lower fetters, as the destruction of the five higher fetters.🔽They review Nibbāna as the destruction of the ten defilements of wisdom, as the destruction of the four floods, as the destruction of the four bonds, as the destruction of the four yokes, as the destruction of the four clingings, as the destruction of the five wildernesses in the heart, as the destruction of the five hindrances, as the destruction of the seven underlying tendencies, as the destruction of the seven latent tendencies, as the destruction of the eight worldly conditions, as the destruction of the nine bases of conceit, as the destruction of the ten courses of unprofitable action.🔽They review Nibbāna as the destruction of all defilements, as the destruction of all suffering, as the destruction of all that is formed, as the destruction of all the five aggregates affected by clinging, as the destruction of all the five aggregates affected by clinging at the moment of their arising.🔽They review Nibbāna as the destruction of the five aggregates affected by clinging at the moment of their arising, as the destruction of the five aggregates affected by clinging at the moment of their presence, as the destruction of the five aggregates affected by clinging at the moment of their dissolution.

original: taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: They review Nibbāna as the destruction of the five aggregates affected by clinging at the moment of their arising, presence, and dissolution.

original: Anantarādi🔽Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā sārammaṇā🔽…pe… phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo … samanantarapaccayena paccayo …
analyzed: anantara ādi 🔽sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā sa ārammaṇā 🔽pe phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo samanantara paccayena paccayo
translated: They review Nibbāna as the destruction of the four foundations

analyzed: vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato pe domanassa  uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatana  cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatana
translated: The basis is prior to the mental factors.🔽The object is prior to the mental factors. Eye is prior to eye-consciousness and the things associated with it. Ear is prior to … mind is prior to mind-consciousness and the things associated with it. The object is prior to the mental factors that have it as their object.

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu sārammaṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ

The ear base is prior to … The mind base is prior to mind-consciousness and the things associated with it. The basis is prior to the mental factors that have it as their object.

original: purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The object condition is a condition, as prior condition, for the mental factors that have it as their object.

original: Pacchājātāsevana

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.

translated: A resultant object is a condition, as repetition condition, for a resultant object. … one …

translated: A resultant object is a condition, as kamma condition, for a resultant object, as conascence, and as post-nascence.

analyzed: indriya  sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Faculties🔽An object is a condition, by way of faculty condition, for an object … for three.

original: Anārammaṇo dhammo anārammaṇassa dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo— rūpajīvitindriyaṁ kaṭattārūpānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ anārammaṇassa dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ rūpa jīvitindriyam kaṭattā rūpānam indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-object is a condition, by way of faculty condition, for a non-object— the material faculties are a condition, by way of faculty condition, for the material phenomena that originate together with them and arise later.

original: Anārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo— cakkhundriyaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyindriyaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa indriyapaccayena paccayo.🔽Sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā sārammaṇassa dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo—cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sārammaṇassa dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhu indriyam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāyindriyam kāya viññāṇassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ  sārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā sārammaṇassa dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhu indriyañca
translated: A condition by way of faculty condition is when a non-object mind-element is a condition for the object mind-element.🔽A condition by way of faculty condition is when the eye faculty is a condition for eye-consciousness, … and the body faculty is a condition for body-consciousness.

original: cakkhuviññāṇañca cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇañca cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam indriya paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: A condition by way of faculty condition is when the eye faculty and eye-consciousness are a condition for the aggregates associated with eye-consciousness, …

original: kāyindriyañca kāyaviññāṇañca kāyaviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kāya indriyam ca kāya viññāṇam ca kāya viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and the body faculty and body-consciousness are a condition for the aggregates associated with body-consciousness.

original: Jhānādi
analyzed: jhāna ādi
translated: Jhana, etc.

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa jhānapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi, maggapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi, sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi magga paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ eka
translated: A condition by way of jhana condition … three … A condition by way of path condition … three … A condition by way of association condition … one.

original: Vippayutta
analyzed: vippayutta
translated: Dissociated

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo anārammaṇassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ anārammaṇassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta pacchājāta
translated: A condition by way of a dissociative condition is when a object mind-element is a condition for the non-object mind-element. (Condensed.)

original: Anārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ,🔽purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu sārammaṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta  purejāta sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu sa ārammaṇānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena
translated: prenascent. Conascent: at the time of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the object dhammas, the aggregates, as a condition by way of dissociation condition.🔽Prenascent: the eye base is related to eye-consciousness … the body base is related to body-consciousness …

original: paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa🔽vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; vatthu sārammaṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa  vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu sa ārammaṇānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as a condition by way of dissociation condition. The physical basis is related to the object dhammas, the aggregates, as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu sārammaṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu sa ārammaṇānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The five sense doors and the mind element are a condition, as presence condition, for the five kinds of sense consciousness and for the kinds of materiality that are its support.

original: Sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā sārammaṇassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: sārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā sārammaṇassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A condition, as presence condition, for a resultant and a non-resultant, and for a non-resultant, is conascence,

original: purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—cakkhuviññāṇasahagato eko khandho ca cakkhāyatanañca tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: purejāta sahajātaḥ cakkhu viññāṇa sahagataḥ ekaḥ khandho ca cakkhu āyatanam ca
translated: prior and post-nascence. Conascence: the eye faculty and the two aggregates are a condition, as presence condition, for the three aggregates that are their support.

original: khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagato eko
analyzed: khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca pe kāya viññāṇa sahagataḥ eko
translated: The two aggregates and the mind faculty are a condition, as presence condition, for the three aggregates that are their support.🔽The eye faculty and the three aggregates are a condition, as presence condition, for the three aggregates that are their support.

original: khandho ca kāyāyatanañca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā🔽ca …pe… sārammaṇo eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo
analyzed: khandho ca kāya āyatanañca tiṇṇannam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā  ca pe sa ārammaṇaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The two aggregates and the mind faculty are a condition, as presence condition, for the three aggregates that are their support.🔽The eye faculty and the three aggregates are a condition, as presence condition, for the three kinds of materiality that are their support.

original: …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: pe dve khandhā ca pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe
translated: The two aggregates and the mind faculty are a condition, as presence condition, for the three kinds of materiality that are their support.

original: Sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā anārammaṇassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: sārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā anārammaṇassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A condition, as presence condition, for a resultant and a non-resultant, and for a non-resultant, is conascence,

original: pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Sahajātā—sārammaṇā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ
analyzed: pacchājāta āhāra indriya sahajāta asārammaṇā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca
translated: Postnascent, nutriment, faculty. Conascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Pacchājātā—sārammaṇā khandhā🔽ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—sārammaṇā
analyzed: rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe pacchājātā a sa ārammaṇāḥ khandhāḥ  ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo pacchājātā asārammaṇā
translated: Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness at the moment of rebirth-linking.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the materiality of the physical heart- basis.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by nutriment.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by temperature.

original: khandhā ca rūpajīvitindriyañca kaṭattārūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: khandhā ca rūpa jīvita indriyam ca kaṭattā rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ  saṅkhyāvāra
translated: Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness at the moment of rebirth-linking.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by nutriment.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by temperature.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by nutriment.

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by temperature.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by nutriment.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte🔽satta, aññamaññe cha, nissaye satta, upanissaye dve, purejāte ekaṁ, pacchājāte ekaṁ,
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā cattāri anantare eka samanantare eka sahajāte  satta aññamaññe cha nissaye satta upanissaye dve purejāte eka pacchājāte eka

original: āsevane ekaṁ, kamme tīṇi, vipāke tīṇi, āhāre cattāri, indriye cha, jhāne tīṇi, magge
analyzed: āsevane eka kamme tīṇi vipāke tīṇi āhāre cattāri indriye cha jhāne tīṇi magge
translated: Postnascent, the object-condition is a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by

original: tīṇi, sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte dve, atthiyā satta, natthiyā ekaṁ, vigate ekaṁ, avigate satta.
analyzed: tīṇi sampayutte eka vippayutte dve atthiyā satta natthiyā eka vigate eka avigate satta
translated: three, one as conjoined, two as not conjoined, seven as present, one as absent, one as past, seven as not past.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-related phenomenon is a condition, as object condition, for a causally-related phenomenon … for a causally-related phenomenon, as conascence condition … as support condition … as kamma condition.

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-related phenomenon is a condition, as conascence condition, for a non-causally-related phenomenon … as post-nascence condition … as kamma condition.

original: Sārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa ca anārammaṇassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa ca anārammaṇassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-related phenomenon is a condition, as conascence condition, as kamma condition, for a causally-related and a non-causally-related phenomenon.

original: Anārammaṇo dhammo anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-causally-related phenomenon is a condition, as conascence condition, for a non-causally-related phenomenon … as nutriment condition … as faculty condition …

original: Anārammaṇo dhammo sārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ sa ārammaṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo
translated: A condition that is not a object condition is related to a condition that is a object condition as object condition … is related to a condition that is a object condition as co-nascence condition … is related to a condition that is a object condition as support condition … is related to a condition that is a object condition as pre-nascence condition.

original: Sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā sārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: sārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā sārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta
translated: A condition that is a object condition and a condition that is not a object condition are related to a condition that is a object condition as co-nascence and as pre-nascence.

original: Sārammaṇo ca anārammaṇo ca dhammā anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: sārammaṇaḥ ca anārammaṇaḥ ca dhammā anārammaṇassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya
translated: A condition that is a object condition and a condition that is not a object condition are related to a condition that is not a object condition as co-nascence, as post-nascence, as nutriment, and as faculty.

original: 2.10.1.7.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya
translated: … The section on conditions in reverse order.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration.

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure.

original: Nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta …pe… nasamanantare satta, nasahajāte cha, na aññamaññe
analyzed: na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta pe na samanantare satta na sahajāte cha na aññamaññe
translated: In the absence of a cause there are seven, in the absence of an object there are seven … in the absence of an immediately prior condition there are seven, in the absence of a conascence there are six, in the absence of a mutuality there are six,

original: cha, nanissaye cha, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta …pe…
analyzed: cha na nissaye cha na upanissaye satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta pe
translated: in the absence of support there are six, in the absence of a decisive support there are seven, in the absence of a prenascence there are seven, in the absence of a postnascence there are seven …

original: namagge satta, nasampayutte cha, navippayutte pañca, noatthiyā cattāri, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na magge satta na sampayutte cha na vippayutte pañca no atthiyā cattāri no natthiyā
translated: in the absence of a path there are seven, in the absence of a association there are six, in the absence of a dissociation there are five, in the absence of a presence there are four, in the absence of a non-presence there are seven,

original: satta, novigate satta, noavigate cattāri.
analyzed: satta no vigate satta no avigate cattāri
translated: in the absence of a disappearance there are seven, in the absence of a non-disappearance there are four.

original: 2.10.1.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya

analyzed: cittam dhammam paṭicca no cittaḥ dhammo uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā cittam paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe

translated: With the mind and the mental factors as condition, the materiality originated by consciousness is a condition, as conditionality condition, for the four great primaries

original: Cittañca nocittañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nocitto dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā—cittañca🔽sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, cittañca mahābhūte ca paṭicca🔽cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittañca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca
analyzed: cittam ca no cittañca dhammam paṭicca no cittaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā cittam ca  sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa cittam ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca  citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam ca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca
translated: With a mentality-dhamma and a non-mentality-dhamma as conditions, a non-mentality-dhamma arises, not through object-condition: With a mentality-dhamma and the associated aggregates as conditions, materiality derived from the four great elements arises. With a mentality-dhamma and the great primaries as conditions, materiality originated by consciousness arises. At the moment of rebirth-linking, with a mentality-dhamma and the associated aggregates as conditions, the mentality-materiality that is rebirth-linking arises.

original: kaṭattārūpaṁ, cittañca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Naadhipatyādi
analyzed: cittañca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpa  na adhipati ādi
translated: With consciousness and with a mental factor as condition, a mental factor arises that is not related to consciousness, not as object condition … With consciousness and the mental factors associated with it as condition, the form that is derived from consciousness arises … At the stage of rebirth-linking, with consciousness and the mental factors associated with it as condition, the materiality of the heart-basis arises … With consciousness and the great elements as condition, the form that is derived from consciousness arises … At the stage of rebirth-linking, with consciousness and the great elements as condition, the form derived from nutriment that is clung to by the aggregates associated with that consciousness arises.

original: Cittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocitto dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … pañca … naanantarapaccayā …pe… naupanissayapaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Napurejātādi🔽Cittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocitto dhammo uppajjati napurejātapaccayā—arūpe cittaṁ paṭicca🔽sampayuttakā khandhā, cittaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ
analyzed: cittam dhammam paṭicca no cittaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā pañca na anantara paccayā pe na upanissaya paccayā tīṇi  napurejāta ādi  cittam dhammam paṭicca no cittaḥ dhammo uppajjati na purejāta paccayā arūpe cittam paṭicca  sampayuttakā khandhā cittam paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe citta
translated: With consciousness as condition, a mental factor that is not related to consciousness arises, not as predominance condition … five … not as proximity condition … not as contiguity condition … not as support condition … three …

original: paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ.
analyzed: paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpa
translated: With consciousness as condition, a mental factor that is not related to consciousness arises, not as post-nascence condition … In the immaterial sphere, with consciousness as condition, the mental factors associated with it arise … With consciousness as condition, the form that is derived from consciousness arises … At the stage of rebirth-linking, with consciousness as condition, the mental factors associated with it and the form that is derived from consciousness arise … At the stage of rebirth-linking, with consciousness as condition, the mental factors associated with it and the form derived from nutriment that is clung to by the aggregates associated with that consciousness arise.

analyzed: no cittam ekam khandhañca cittam ca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe no citte  khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa cittam ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca  citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam ca vatthum ca paṭicca no cittāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: With the exception of consciousness, there is a single factor and consciousness, and with two factors, and with two factors and consciousness, and with the exception of consciousness, there is a single factor and consciousness, and with two factors, and with two factors and consciousness.🔽With the exception of consciousness, there is a single factor and consciousness, and with two factors, and with two factors and consciousness, and with the exception of consciousness, there is a single factor and consciousness, and with two factors, and with two factors and consciousness.

translated: With neither as condition, there are five. With neither as object, there are three. With neither as predominance, there are five. With neither as antecedent, there are three. With neither as proximate, there are three. With neither as associated, there are three. With neither as supported, there are three. With neither as prior and associated, there are three. With neither as prior and not associated, there are three. With neither as result, there are three. With neither as nutriment, there is one. With neither as faculty, there is one. With neither as path, there are three. With neither as fruition, there are three. With neither as cankerous, there are three. With neither as pertaining to cankers, there are three. With neither as relation, there are three. With neither as root cause, there are three. With neither as prenascence, there are three. With neither as postnascence, there are three. With neither as repetition, there are three. With neither as kamma, there are three. With neither as ripening, there are three. With neither as nutriment, there is one. With neither as faculty, there is one. With neither as jhāna, there are three. With neither as path, there are three. With neither as association, there are three. With neither as dissociation, there are three. With neither as disappearance, there are three. With neither as appearance, there are three.

translated: With a condition by way of root cause, there are three without as object. With five without as predominance. (In brief.)

original: 2.10.2.1.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe pañca, anantare pañca (sabbattha pañca), magge tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.🔽2.10.2.2. Sahajātavāra
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe pañca anantare pañca sabbattha pañca magge tīṇi pe avigate pañca  sahajātavāra
translated: With no condition as decisive support there are five. With no condition as proximate there are five. (In all sections there are five.) With no condition as path there are three. … With no condition as foundation there are five.

analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
