original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as support condition, as prenascence condition, as kamma condition.

original: Citto ca nocitto ca dhammā cittassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citto ca nocitto ca dhammā cittassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo
translated: A mind and a mind-object are a condition, as object condition, for a mind.

original: Citto ca nocitto ca dhammā nocittassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citto ca no cittaḥ ca dhammā no cittassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: A mind and a mind-object are a condition, as object condition, as arising together condition, as support condition, as prenascence condition, as postnascence condition,

original: Citto ca nocitto ca dhammā cittassa ca nocittassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citto ca no cittaḥ ca dhammā cittassa ca no cittassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A mind and a mind-object are a condition, as object condition, as support condition, for a mind and for a mind-object.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha

analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava sabbattha nava no avigate nava
translated: In the non-cause section there are nine. In the non-object section there are nine. In all the rest there are nine.

original: 2.10.2.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… nasamanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi (sabbattha tīṇi), namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya  hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe tīṇi pe na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye  tīṇi sabbattha tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: 2.10.2.7.3. Reverse order of conditions in forward order

original: tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na u vigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to conditions as root, there are three in object, … three in proximity, … one in kamma-result, … three in support, … three in nutriment, … three in faculty, … three in path, … one in association, … three in dissociation, … three in presence, … three in absence, … three in dependence, … three in non-disappearance.

original: 2.10.2.7.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: ..... In reverse order of conditions in forward order

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava. (Anulomamātikā kātabbā.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anuloma mātikā kātabbā
translated: With respect to conditions as root, there are nine in object, nine in predominance. (The matrix should be completed in the same way as above.)

original: Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti🔽ārammaṇapaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve
analyzed: cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti  ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cetasikam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve
translated: Dependent on a mental factor and a non-mental factor, a mental factor and a non-mental factor arise …

original: khandhā cittañca, dve khandhe ca …pe….
analyzed: khandhā cittañca dve khandhe ca pe
translated: Dependent on one mental factor and a physical basis, two aggregates and a mind-element. Dependent on two aggregates and a physical basis, a mind-element. …

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominant

original: Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko dhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cetasikam dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati adhipati paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A mental factor arises … (Abbreviated.)

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte🔽nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte pañca, āsevane pañca,🔽kamme nava (sabbattha nava), avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte  nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte pañca āsevane pañca  kamme nava sabbattha nava avigate nava
translated: In the case of the cause, there are nine; in the case of the object, there are nine; in the case of the predominance, there are nine; in the case of the proximity, there are nine; in the case of the contiguity, there are nine; in the case of the arising together,🔽there are nine; in the case of the presence, there are nine; in the case of the support, there are nine; in the case of the decisive support, there are nine; in the case of the prenascence, there are five; in the case of the repetition, there are five;🔽in the case of kamma, there are nine; in the case of nutriment, there are nine; in the case of the faculty, there are nine; in the case of the path, there are nine; in the case of the root, there are nine; in the case of the element, there are nine; in the case of the sphere, there are nine; in the case of the manifestation, there are nine; in the case of the non-disappearance, there are nine.

original: 2.10.3.1.2. Paccayapaccanīya🔽Vibhaṅgavāra🔽Nahetu🔽Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ cetasikaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…🔽vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca acetasiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetuke cetasike khandhe paṭicca cittañca cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….

original: Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ
analyzed: cetasikam dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: With a mental factor as condition, both a mental factor and a materiality not derived from the elements arise, not through a condition being a condition as root.🔽With one mental formation as condition, two mental formations and consciousness and the materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā cittañca cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve🔽khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: cetasikam ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhā cittam ca citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve  khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: With two mental formations … At the moment of rebirth-linking in the non-causally arisen …

original: Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca acetasiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ cittaṁ
analyzed: acetasikam dhammam paṭicca acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam citta
translated: With a materiality not derived from the elements as condition, materiality not derived from the elements arises, not through a condition being a condition as root. With consciousness as condition, materiality derived from the four great primaries. At the moment of rebirth-linking in the non-causally arisen …

original: paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ,🔽cittaṁ paṭicca vatthu, vatthuṁ paṭicca cittaṁ, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… asaññasattānaṁ🔽ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe….🔽Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ cittaṁ
analyzed: paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa  cittam paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca citte ekam mahābhūtam pe  ekam mahābhūtam pe  acetasikam dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam citta
translated: With consciousness as condition, the physical basis. With the physical basis as condition, consciousness. With one great primary as condition … In the case of the non-percipient beings …

original: paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā
analyzed: paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhāḥ ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam paṭicca sampayuttakā
translated: With a materiality not derived from the elements as condition, a mental formation arises, not through a condition being a condition as root. With consciousness as condition, the mental formations associated with it. At the moment of rebirth-linking in the non-causally arisen …🔽With a materiality not derived from the elements as condition, a mental formation and a materiality derived from the four great primaries arise, not through a condition being a condition as root. With consciousness as condition, the mental formations and the materiality derived from the four great primaries associated with it.

original: khandhā, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca cetasikā khandhā, vicikicchāsahagataṁ🔽uddhaccasahagataṁ cittaṁ paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: khandhāḥ ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca cetasikā khandhā vicikicchā sahagata  uddhacca sahagatam cittam paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: When a mind with uncertainty and a mind with restlessness are a condition for uncertainty and for restlessness, then a mental factor is a condition for a mental factor.

original: Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ🔽cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: acetasikam dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetuka  cittam paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: When a mind without root-cause is a condition for the mental factors and for the materiality originated by the mind, then a mind without root-cause is a condition for a mental factor and for materiality.

original: cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ
analyzed: cittam paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: At the first two kinds of rebirth-linking, when a mind without root-cause is a condition for the associated aggregates and for the materiality of the kinds already mentioned, and at the first two kinds of rebirth-linking when the physical basis is a condition for the mind and for the associated aggregates,

original: paṭicca cittañca sampayuttakā ca khandhā.🔽Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ
analyzed: paṭicca cittam ca sampayuttakāḥ ca khandhāḥ  cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: then a mind without root-cause is a condition for a mental factor and for materiality.🔽When a mental and a non-mental factor are a condition for a mental factor, then a non-mental factor is a condition for a mental factor.🔽When one of the aggregates that is a mental factor and the mind are a condition for two aggregates, and when two of the aggregates that are mental factors and the mind are a condition for one aggregate, then a non-mental factor is a condition for a mental factor.

original: cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: cetasikam ekam khandhañca cittam ca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: At the first two kinds of rebirth-linking …

original: cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: cetasikam ekam khandhañca cittam ca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: Mind-made and the physical basis.🔽In a consciousness-moment associated with uncertainty,

original: cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… vicikicchāsahagate
analyzed: cetasikam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe vicikicchā sahagate
translated: In a consciousness-moment associated with agitation,

original: uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: the mental factor of delusion associated with uncertainty and associated with agitation.

original: Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca acetasiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetuke
analyzed: cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paṭicca acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuke
translated: From a mind-made and a not-mind-made condition, a not-mind-made state arises through a condition that is not a root-cause. At the linking of conception that is without root-cause,

original: cetasike khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, ahetuke cetasike khandhe
analyzed: cetasike khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuke cetasike khandhe
translated: From mind-made aggregates and mind, materiality originated by mind. From mind-made aggregates

original: ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cetasike
analyzed: ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe cetasike
translated: and the great primaries, materiality originated by mind. At the linking of conception that is without root-cause,

original: khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cetasike khandhe
analyzed: khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe cetasike khandhe
translated: from mind-made aggregates and mind, derived materiality. At the linking of conception that is without root-cause, from mind-made aggregates🔽and the great primaries,

original: ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cetasike khandhe ca🔽vatthuñca paṭicca cittaṁ.
analyzed: ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cetasike khandhe ca  vatthuñca paṭicca citta
translated: The mind arises in dependence on the mental factors and the material phenomena derived from the four great elements.

original: Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paṭicca cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti
translated: In dependence on a mental and a non-mental state, a mental and a non-mental state arise.

original: nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ahetukam cetasikam ekam khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca
translated: In dependence on a single root-cause mental state, two aggregates and the material phenomena derived from the four great elements arise.🔽At the time of rebirth-linking without root-cause, in dependence on a single root-cause mental state, two aggregates and the material phenomena derived from the four great elements arise.

original: rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā🔽kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca
analyzed: rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cetasikam ekam khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā  kaṭattā ca rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe cetasikam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking without root-cause, in dependence on a single root-cause mental state and the physical heart-basis, two aggregates and the mind arise.

original: dve khandhā cittañca, dve khandhe ca …pe….
analyzed: dve khandhā cittam ca dve khandhe ca pe
translated: In dependence on two aggregates and the physical heart-basis, the mind arises.

original: Naārammaṇa
analyzed: na ārammaṇa
translated: Non-object

original: Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca acetasiko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā— cetasike khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: cetasikam dhammam paṭicca acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā cetasike khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: In dependence on a mental state, a non-mental state arises, not through object condition—in dependence on the aggregates that are mental factors, the material phenomena derived from the four great elements arise. At the time of rebirth-linking …

original: Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca acetasiko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā— cittaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Yāva asaññasattā.)🔽Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca acetasiko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā—cetasike🔽khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, cetasike khandhe ca mahābhūte
analyzed: acetasikam dhammam paṭicca acetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā cittam paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe yāva asaññasattā  cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paṭicca acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā cetasike  khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa cetasike khandhe ca mahābhūte
translated: With a non-mental factor as condition, a non-mental factor arises, not as object condition. With mind as condition, the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. At the instant of rebirth-linking … (up to) … in the case of beings without thought.

original: ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā, saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā saṅkhitta
translated: With a mental factor and a non-mental factor as condition, a non-mental factor arises, not as object condition. With the mental factors and the mind as condition, the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. With the mental factors and the great primaries as condition, the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. (In the case of rebirth-linking, both should be taken in brief.)

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Modes of Direct Relation

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane
translated: The Pure

original: nava, nakamme cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne cha,
analyzed: nava na kamme cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne cha
translated: In the non-cause, nine; in the non-object, three; in the non-dominance, nine; in the non-antecedent, three; in the non-conascence, three; in the non-nurture, three; in the non-kamma, four; in the non-result, nine; in the non-nutriment, one; in the non-faculty, one; in the non-path, three; in the non- jhāna, six; in the non-fruit, three; in the non-reflexion, three; in the non-non-causality, nine; in the non-non-object, three; in the non-non-dominance, nine; in the non-non-antecedent, three; in the non-non-conascence, three; in the non-non-nurture, three; in the non-non-kamma, nine; in the non-non-result, nine; in the non-non-nutriment, one; in the non-non-faculty, one; in the non-non-path, six; in the non-non-jhāna, three; in the non-non-fruit, three; in the non-non-reflexion, three.

original: namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: in the clause on the name-group, there are nine; in the clause on non-associated with consciousness, there are three; in the clause on not conditionally, there are three; in the clause on not indirectly, there are three.

original: 2.10.3.1.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: .... In the section on the reverse order of conditions,

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava
translated: in the clause on condition being root, there are three in the clause on not object, nine in the clause on not predominance, (abbreviated).

original: 2.10.3.1.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: .... In the section on the forward order of conditions,

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava, anantare nava …pe… purejāte pañca, āsevane pañca, kamme nava (sabbattha nava), magge tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava anantare nava pe purejāte pañca āsevane pañca kamme nava sabbattha nava magge tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: in the clause on condition being not root, there are nine in the clause on object, nine in the clause on proximity, nine … in the clause on prenascence, five, in the clause on repetition, five, in the clause on kamma, nine (in all cases), in the clause on path, three … in the clause on not having been, there are nine.

original: 2.10.3.2. Sahajātavāra
analyzed: sahajātavāra
translated: .... The section on conascence

original: Sahajātavāropi paṭiccavārasadiso.🔽2.10.3.3. Paccayavāra
analyzed: sahajāta vāraḥ api paṭicca vāra sadisaḥ  paccaya vāra
translated: The section on conascence is similar to the section on condition.🔽.... The section on conditions

original: 2.10.3.3.1. Paccayānuloma
analyzed: paccaya anuloma
translated: .... In the section on the forward order of conditions,

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The exposition

original: Hetu🔽Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Paṭiccasadisā.)
analyzed: hetu  cetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi paṭicca sadisā
translated: Root cause🔽With a mental factor as condition, a mental factor arises: with three conditions. (The rest are similar to the dependent origination.)

original: Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittaṁ paccayā
analyzed: acetasikam dhammam paccayā acetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā cittam paccayā
translated: With a non-mental factor as condition, a non-mental factor arises: with mind as condition, the mental factors,

original: cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā cittaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paccayā kaṭattārūpaṁ,🔽cittaṁ paccayā vatthu, vatthuṁ paccayā cittaṁ, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe….🔽Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittaṁ paccayā sampayuttakā khandhā, vatthuṁ paccayā cetasikā khandhā. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)🔽Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—cittaṁ
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa vatthum paccayā citta paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam paccayā kaṭattā rūpa  cittam paccayā vatthu vatthum paccayā citte ekam mahābhūtam pe  acetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā cittam paccayā sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ vatthum paccayā cetasikāḥ khandhāḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā  acetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā acitta
translated: Materiality originated by consciousness is related to consciousness as a condition consisting in a basis. At the moment of rebirth-linking, consciousness is related to the formations as a condition consisting in a decisive support. At the moment of rebirth-linking, consciousness is related to the materiality of the physical heart- basis as a condition consisting in a decisive support.🔽Consciousness is related to the materiality of the physical heart-basis as a condition consisting in a decisive support. The materiality of the physical heart-basis is related to consciousness as a condition consisting in a basis. One of the great essentials is related to consciousness as a condition consisting in a decisive support.

original: paccayā sampayuttakā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā cittañca sampayuttakā🔽ca khandhā. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)
analyzed: paccayā sampayuttakā khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa vatthum paccayā cittañca sampayuttakā  ca khandhā paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā
translated: When a mental state is related to a mental state as a condition consisting in a cause, then either one or two should be stated. When a non-mental state is related to a mental state as a condition consisting in a cause, then either one or two should be stated.🔽When a non-mental state is related to a mental state and to a non-mental state as a condition consisting in a cause, then either one or two should be stated.

original: Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cetasikaṁ
analyzed: cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā acetasika
translated: When a mental state and a non-mental state are related to a mental state as a condition consisting in a cause, then either one or two should be stated.

original: ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… cetasikaṁ ekaṁ
analyzed: ekam khandhañca cittam ca paccayā dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe cetasikam eka
translated: and mind as condition, two aggregates, two aggregates and mind as condition … a mental formation …

original: khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)🔽Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paccayā acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cetasike🔽khandhe ca cittañca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, cetasike khandhe ca mahābhūte
analyzed: khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā  cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paccayā acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā acetasike  khandhe ca cittam ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa cetasike khandhe ca mahābhūte
translated: With one aggregate and consciousness as condition, two aggregates. With two aggregates and consciousness as condition, two aggregates. With one of the mental aggregates and the physical basis as condition, two aggregates. With two of the mental aggregates and the physical basis as condition, two aggregates. (In the case of rebirth-linking, two should be done.)

original: ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, cetasike khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā cittaṁ.🔽(Paṭisandhikkhaṇe tīṇipi kātabbā.)🔽Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa cetasike khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā citta  paṭisandhi khaṇe tīṇi pi kātabbā  cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti
translated: With a mental and a non-mental state as condition, a non-mental state arises … With the mental aggregates and consciousness as condition, the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries. With the mental aggregates and the great primaries as condition, the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries. With the mental aggregates and the physical basis as condition, consciousness. (In the case of rebirth-linking, three should be done.)

original: hetupaccayā—cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paccayā dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca
analyzed: hetu paccayā cetasikam ekam khandhañca cittañca paccayā dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca
translated: With a mental and a non-mental state as condition, a mental and a non-mental state … With one of the mental aggregates and consciousness as condition, two aggregates and the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries. With two of the mental aggregates and consciousness as condition, two aggregates and the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: rūpaṁ, dve khandhe ca …pe… cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā
analyzed: dve khandhe ca pe cetasikam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā
translated: A mental factor as condition, and the physical basis as condition, for two aggregates.

original: cittañca, dve khandhe ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)
analyzed: cittam ca dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā
translated: Mind and two aggregates. (Also in the case of rebirth-linking, two should be constructed.)

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi. (Paṭiccasadisā.)🔽Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā acetasiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā— cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: ārammaṇa  cetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi paṭicca sadisā  acetasikam dhammam paccayā acetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu āyatana
translated: Object Condition🔽A mental factor as condition, a mental factor as condition, for three. (The same method applies to the remaining two tetrads.)

original: paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā cittaṁ;
analyzed: paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā citta
translated: A non-mental factor as condition, a non-mental factor as condition, for a non-mental factor … Eye as condition … for eye-consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with eye-consciousness. … Body as condition … for body-consciousness … for the states associated with and conascent with body-consciousness. The physical basis as condition, the physical basis as condition, for mind.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā— cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  acetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu āyatana
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: paccayā cakkhuviññāṇasahagatā khandhā …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā …pe… cittaṁ paccayā
analyzed: paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatā khandhā pe kāya āyatanam paccayā pe cittam paccayā
translated: A non-mental factor as condition, a non-mental factor as condition, for a mental factor … Eye as condition … for the states associated with and conascent with eye-consciousness. … Body as condition … for the states associated with and conascent with body-consciousness. The physical basis as condition, the physical basis as condition, for mind.

original: sampayuttakā khandhā, vatthuṁ paccayā cetasikā khandhā. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)🔽Acetasikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ vatthum paccayā cetasikāḥ khandhāḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā  acetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu āyatana
translated: the associated aggregates. The physical basis is a condition, as object condition, for the mental aggregates. (At the moment of rebirth two should be given in full.)

original: paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ sampayuttakā ca khandhā …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā …pe… vatthuṁ🔽paccayā cittaṁ sampayuttakā ca khandhā. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe ekaṁ.)🔽Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhuviññāṇañca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ
analyzed: paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam sampayuttakā ca khandhā pe kāya āyatanam paccayā pe vatthu  paccayā cittam sampayuttakā ca khandhā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe eka  cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagata  ekam khandhañca cakkhu viññāṇañca paccayā dve khandhā dve khandhe ca pe cakkhu viññāṇa sahagata
translated: A non-mental state is a condition, as object condition, for a mental state and a non-mental state: the eye base is a condition, as object condition, for eye-consciousness and for the aggregates associated with it. … The body base is a condition, as object condition, for body-consciousness and for the aggregates associated with it. The physical basis is a condition, as object condition, for consciousness and for the aggregates associated with it. (At the moment of rebirth one should be given in full.)🔽A mental state and a non-mental state are a condition, as object condition, for a mental state: when a single aggregate … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … is a condition, as object condition, for two aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … is a condition, as object condition, for three aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … is a condition, as object condition, for four aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … is a condition, as object condition, for five aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … is a condition, as object condition, for the mental factors associated with eye-consciousness.

original: ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagataṁ
analyzed: ekam khandhañca cakkhu āyatanañca paccayā dve khandhā dve khandhe ca pe kāya viññāṇa sahagata
translated: A mental state and a non-mental state are a condition, as object condition, for a mental state: when two aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … are a condition, as object condition, for three aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … are a condition, as object condition, for four aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … are a condition, as object condition, for five aggregates … (as in Sutta 14, §1) … are a condition, as object condition, for the mental factors associated with body-consciousness.

original: …pe… cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe…
analyzed: pe cetasikam ekam khandhañca cittam ca paccayā dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe
translated: … a mental factor as condition, and one aggregate and consciousness as condition, for two aggregates …

original: cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dve.)🔽Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paccayā acetasiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagate
analyzed: cetasikam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhi khaṇe dve  cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paccayā acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagate
translated: a mental factor as condition, and a physical basis as condition, for two aggregates … (as in the section on rebirth-linking, §105, with the addition of the words “and a mental factor” after “a physical basis” in each case.)

original: khandhe ca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagate …pe… cetasike
analyzed: khandhe ca cakkha āyatanam ca paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya viññāṇa sahagate pe cetasike
translated: A mental factor and a non-mental factor as condition, a non-mental factor as condition, for a state of consciousness … Eye-consciousness and the states associated with it … Body-consciousness and the states associated with it …

original: khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā cittaṁ. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe ekaṁ.)
analyzed: khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā citta paṭisandhi khaṇe eka
translated: a mental factor as condition, and a physical basis as condition, for consciousness. (In the case of rebirth-linking, there is one kind.)

original: Cetasikañca acetasikañca dhammaṁ paccayā cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: cetasikam ca acetasikam ca dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti
translated: A mental factor and a non-mental factor as condition, a mental factor and a non-mental factor as condition, for a state of consciousness …🔽Eye-consciousness and the states associated with it …

original: ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā dve🔽khandhā cakkhuviññāṇañca, dve khandhe ca …pe… cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatam ekam khandhañca cakkhu āyatanañca paccayā dve 🔽khandhā cakkhu viññāṇañca dve khandhe ca pe cetasikam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca
translated: a mental factor as condition, and a physical basis as condition, for two aggregates …

original: paccayā dve khandhā cittañca, dve khandhe ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe ekaṁ, saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayā dve khandhā cittam ca dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: Two aggregates and consciousness. Two aggregates and the mental factors. (At the moment of rebirth-linking, one. In brief.)

analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra

analyzed: suddha

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava (sabbattha nava), purejāte nava, āsevane nava …pe… avigate nava.🔽2.10.3.3.2. Paccayapaccanīya

translated: As root-cause, nine; as object, nine; as predominance, nine; as prenascence, nine; as postnascence, nine; as nutriment, nine; as association, nine; as dissociation, nine; as presence, nine; as absence, nine; as non-disappearance, nine.🔽..... As condition being reversed🔽The section on analysis

original: Vibhaṅgavāra🔽Nahetu
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra  na hetu

analyzed: cetasikam dhammam paccayā cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam
translated: A mental formation as condition, a mental formation arises, as non-root-cause condition—a root-causeless mental formation. (In brief.)

original: (Nava pañhā pañcaviññāṇampi yathā ārammaṇapaccayā evaṁ kātabbaṁ, tīsuyeva moho. Sabbe pañhā pavattipaṭisandhiyā kātabbā asammohantena.)
analyzed: nava pañhā pañca viññāṇam pi yathā ārammaṇa paccayāḥ evam moho sabbe pañhā pavatti paṭisandhiyā kātabbā asammoha antena
translated: (Nine questions. Five kinds of consciousness. As object condition, so should it be done. In three only, delusion. All the questions should be done by one who is not deluded about the occurrence and rebirth-linking.)

analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra

analyzed: tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane

analyzed: nava na kamme cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne nava
translated: Nine, in non-action four, in non-result nine, in non-nutriment one, in non-faculty one, in non-jhana nine,

original: namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: in non-path nine, in non-association three, in non-dissociation six, in non-dependence three, in non-relation three.

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava anantare nava sabbattha nava magge tīṇi pe avigate nava  nissaya vāra  mahantaraduka

original: Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho cetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: cetasikam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ cetasikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā cetasikam ekam khandham sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: A mental state is associated with a mental state as condition: with one mental formation associated with two mental formations, with two mental formations … at the mind-element … at the mind-consciousness element … at the time of rebirth-linking …

original: Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho acetasiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— cetasiko khandhe saṁsaṭṭhaṁ cittaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Cetasikaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā— cetasikaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā cittañca, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….

translated: Conditioned by a mental factor associated with a non-mental factor, a mental factor arises, by way of root-cause condition …🔽Conditioned by a mental factor associated with a mental factor and a non-mental factor, a mental factor and a non-mental factor arise, by way of root-cause condition …

analyzed: cittassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: (The root should be asked about.) Predominance as object: having given importance to the mental factors, the mental factors and consciousness arise. co-nascent predominance: the predominance of the mental factors is a condition, as predominance condition, for the associated aggregates, for consciousness, and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Acetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A non-mental factor is a condition, as predominance condition, for a non-mental factor, as object-predominance.

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe nibbānam garum katvā
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, as object predominance and as associated predominance.

original: paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa. Maggassa, phalassa adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ acetasike khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,🔽taṁ garuṁ katvā cittaṁ uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—acetasikādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ
analyzed: paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthum acetasike khandhe garum katvā assādeti abhinandati  tam garum katvā cittam uppajjati sahajāta ādhipati acetasika ādhipati citta samuṭṭhānāna
translated: The condition being by way of object predominance is when noble persons, having emerged from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, review the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling as peaceful and sublime. The attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling is a condition, by way of object predominance, for the prenascent and for the path and for the fruit.🔽The condition being by way of object predominance is when, having made the materiality of the physical basis great, one delights in the non-mental factors.🔽The condition being by way of associated predominance is when a non-mental factor is a condition, by way of predominance, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being by way of object predominance is when noble persons, having emerged from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, review the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling as peaceful and sublime.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā🔽…pe… (paṭhamagamanasadisaṁ); cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ acetasike khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati 🔽sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe nibbānam garum katvā 🔽cakkhum pe vatthum acetasike khandhe garum katvā assādeti
translated: The condition being by way of object predominance is when, having made the materiality of the physical basis great, one delights in the non-mental factors.

original: abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—acetasikādhipati
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati sahajāta ādhipati acetasika ādhipati
translated: When he approves of and gives importance to that, lust, hatred and views arise.

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Co-nascent predominance: predominance of the non-mental factor over the associated aggregates.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… nibbānaṁ …pe… (paṭhamagamanaṁ)🔽acetasike khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā cetasikā khandhā
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe nibbānam pe paṭhama gamana  acetasike khandhe garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā cetasikā khandhā
translated: A non-mental factor is related to a mental factor and a non-mental factor as a pre-nascent condition…🔽A non-mental factor is related to a mental factor and a non-mental factor as a pre-nascent condition…

original: ca cittañca uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—acetasikādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca cittam ca uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati acetasika adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam  citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: When he approves of and gives importance to the non-mental aggregates, mental and non-mental aggregates…🔽Co-nascent predominance: predominance of the non-mental factor over the associated aggregates and over the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽A mental factor and a non-mental factor are related to a mental factor as a pre-nascent condition…

original: Cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā cetasikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati … tīṇi. (Ārammaṇādhipatiyeva.)
analyzed: cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā cetasikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati tīṇi ārammaṇa adhipatiyā eva
translated: Three kinds of conditions are given in the Abhidhamma as the pre-nascent condition. The pre-nascent condition is given in the Abhidhamma as a condition in three ways, that is to say, as object-predominance, etc., and as co-nascence, etc.

original: Anantarādi🔽Cetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā cetasikā
analyzed: anantara ādi  cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimā cetasikā
translated: Immediate, etc.🔽A mental factor is a condition, as an immediate condition, for a mental factor. The former mental factors are a condition, as an immediate condition, for the latter mental factors.

original: khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ cetasikānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽(Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.) Purimā purimā cetasikā khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa cittassa
analyzed: khandhāḥ pacchimānam pacchimānam cetasikānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  mūlam pucchitabba purimā purimā cetasikā khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa cittassa
translated: Immediately preceding condition means: a mental factor is to a mental factor an immediately preceding condition. The prior prior aggregates are to the subsequent subsequent aggregates an immediately preceding condition.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.) Purimā purimā cetasikā khandhā pacchimānaṁ🔽pacchimānaṁ cetasikānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Acetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimaṁ purimaṁ🔽cittaṁ pacchimassa pacchimassa cittassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; anulomaṁ gotrabhussa
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam pucchitabba purimā purimā cetasikā khandhā  pacchimānam cetasikānam khandhānam cittassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purima  cittam pacchimassa pacchimassa cittassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa
translated: (The root should be asked about.) The prior prior aggregates are to the subsequent subsequent consciousness an immediately preceding condition. (The root should be asked about.) The prior prior aggregates are to the subsequent subsequent aggregates and to consciousness an immediately preceding condition.

original: …pe… phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: A non-mental factor is to a non-mental factor an immediately preceding condition. The prior prior consciousness is to the subsequent subsequent consciousness an immediately preceding condition. The conformity is to the change-of-lineage … and so on… is to the attainment of fruition an immediately preceding condition.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Evaṁ tīṇi kātabbāni, paṭhamagamanasadisaṁ. Pūritvā kātabbaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ evam tīṇi kātabbāni paṭhama gamana sadisa pūritvā kātabba ninnānākaraṇa
translated: A state that is not associated with consciousness is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is associated with consciousness. (Three should be done as in the first section on going forth. They should be filled out. There is no difference.)

original: Cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā cetasikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Āvajjanāpi vuṭṭhānampi natthi.)🔽Samanantarapaccayena paccayo … nava, sahajātapaccayena paccayo … nava (paṭiccavārasadisaṁ),🔽aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nava (paṭiccavārasadisaṁ), nissayapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā cetasikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo tīṇi āvajjanā api vuṭṭhānam pi natthi  samanantara paccayena paccaḥ nava sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ nava  aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nava nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is associated with consciousness and a state that is not associated with consciousness are a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is associated with consciousness. (There is no adverting or arising.)

original: … nava. (Paccayavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: nava paccaya vāra sadisa
translated: As condition being sequential condition … nine. As condition being decisive-support condition … nine. (As in the section on condition.)

original: Upanissaya🔽Cetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: upanissaya  cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: As decisive-support condition🔽A state that is associated with consciousness is a condition, as decisive-support condition, for a state that is associated with consciousness: decisive-support as object,

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—cetasikā khandhā cetasikānaṁ
analyzed: anantara upanissayo pakata upanissayo pe pakata upanissayo cetasikā khandhā
translated: decisive-support as proximity, decisive-support as natural decisive-support. … Natural decisive-support: the associated aggregates are a condition, as decisive-support condition, for the associated aggregates.

original: khandhānaṁ upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ, tīṇi upanissayā.) Cetasikā🔽khandhā cittassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ, tīṇi upanissayā.)
analyzed: khandhānam upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam tīṇi upanissayā cetasikā  khandhā cittassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam tīṇi upanissayā
translated: The mental factors are a condition, as support condition, for the aggregates. (The three kinds of support should be asked about.)🔽The mental factors are a condition, as support condition, for consciousness. (The three kinds of support should be asked about.)

original: Cetasikā khandhā cetasikānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cetasikā khandhā cetasikānam khandhānam cittassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The mental factors are a condition, as support condition, for the mental factors and for consciousness.

original: Acetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo
translated: A non-mental factor is a condition, as support condition, for a non-mental factor: support as object,

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—utuṁ … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe bhojanam senāsana
translated: support as prenascence, support as natural constitution. … Support as natural constitution: the temperature, … nutriment, … the basis,

original: cittaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati; utuṁ … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ cittaṁ
analyzed: cittam upanissāya dānam deti pe saṅgham bhindati utum bhojanam senāsanam citta
translated: having relied on consciousness, one gives a gift … one splits the Saṅgha. The temperature, … nutriment, … the basis,

original: saddhāya …pe… paññāya … rāgassa …pe… patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa, kāyikassa dukkhassa,
analyzed: saddhāya pe paññāya rāgassa pe patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa kāyikassa dukkhassa
translated: having relied on faith, … on wisdom, … on greed, … on aspiration, is a condition, as support condition, for bodily pleasure, bodily pain,

original: maggassa, phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: maggassa phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: for the path, for fruition, and for attainment.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo
translated: A state that is not associated with consciousness is a condition, as support condition, for a state that is associated with consciousness. The support condition is the support condition as object,

original: anantarūpanissayo pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—utuṁ … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ🔽cittaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe…. (Tīṇi, paṭhamagamanasadisaṁ ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe bhojanam senāsana  cittam upanissāya dānam deti pe tīṇi paṭhama gamana sadisam
translated: the support condition as antecedent, and the support condition as natural. The support condition as natural is: the season,🔽food, and the bed and seat are a condition, as support condition, for consciousness.🔽Having confidence in the mind, one gives a gift … (Three, like the first section of the first chapter.)

original: Cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā cetasikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā cetasikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is associated with consciousness and a state that is not associated with consciousness are a condition, as support condition, for a state that is associated with consciousness. There are three.

original: Purejāta
analyzed: purā jāta
translated: Preceding

original: Acetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato pe vipassati assādeti
translated: A state that is not associated with consciousness is a condition, as a preceding condition, for a state that is not associated with consciousness. The preceding condition is the preceding condition as object,

original: abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha cittaṁ uppajjati. Dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya
analyzed: abhinandati tam ārabbha cittam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya
translated: and the preceding condition as physical basis. The preceding condition as object is: One contemplates a form as impermanent … as suffering … as a disease … as a boil … as a dart … as misery … as an affliction … as alien … as disintegrating … as empty … as nonself … as not delighting in … as vanishing … as fading away … as ceasing … as desireless … as peaceful … as sublime … as a danger … as a threat … as a change … as a requisite … as a bondage … as a dart … as having a root … as having a disease … as having a boil … as having a dart … as having a tumour … as having a thorn … as an outbreak … as a ruin … as a disaster … as a calamity … as a terror … as a menace … as fickle … as fluctuating … as unreliable … as subject to change … as having no core … as a void … as a terror of death … as a slayer … as subject to birth … as subject to ageing … as subject to sickness … as subject to death … as subject to sorrow … as subject to lamentation … as subject to despair … as subject to defilement. One sees a form as impermanent, as suffering, as a disease … as a calamity … as a terror … as a menace … as fickle … as fluctuating … as unreliable … as subject to change … as having no core … as a void … as a terror of death … as a slayer … as subject to birth … as subject to ageing … as subject to sickness … as subject to death … as subject to sorrow … as subject to lamentation … as

original: sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa
analyzed: sota dhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa
translated: The ear sense-sphere is the condition for the ear-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The form sense-sphere is the condition for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The sound sense-sphere is the condition for the ear-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The odour sense-sphere is the condition for the nose-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The taste sense-sphere is the condition for the tongue-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The tangible sense-sphere is the condition for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated with it.

original: …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa
analyzed: pe vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa
translated: The eye sense-sphere is the condition for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The ear sense-sphere is the condition for the ear-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The nose sense-sphere is the condition for the nose-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The tongue sense-sphere is the condition for the tongue-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The body sense-sphere is the condition for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated with it.

original: …pe… vatthu cittassa purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,
analyzed: pe vatthu cittassa purejāta paccayena paccayo  acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta
translated: The physical basis is the condition for the mind element and for the states associated with it.🔽An incorporeal condition is a condition for a corporeal state. The object condition is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the object.🔽The physical basis is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the physical basis. The object condition is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the object.🔽The eye is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the eye. The ear … The nose … The tongue … The body … The mind is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the mind.

original: vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ
analyzed: vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato pe domanassa
translated: The physical basis is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the physical basis. The object condition is a condition for the states of equanimity that arise in dependence on the object.

original: uppajjati; dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Rūpāyatanaṁ🔽cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatana 🔽cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇa sahagatāna 🔽khandhānam pe vatthu purejāta cakkhāyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam
translated: The eye sense-sphere is a condition for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The ear sense-sphere is a condition for the ear-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The nose sense-sphere is a condition for the nose-consciousness element and for the states associated with it. The tongue sense-sphere is a condition for the tongue-consciousness

original: …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu cetasikānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu cetasikānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … the body sense-sphere … the physical basis for the mental factors is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the mental factors.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti🔽abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha cittañca sampayuttakā ca khandhā uppajjanti. Dibbena cakkhunā🔽rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa sampayuttakānañca🔽khandhānaṁ …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato pe vipassati assādeti  abhinandati tam ārabbha cittam ca sampayuttakā ca khandhāḥ uppajjanti dibbena cakkhunā  rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca  khandhānam pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam pe vatthu purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: A non-mental factor is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for a mental factor and for a non-mental factor. The prenascent object condition,

original: sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānañca🔽khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Pacchājātāsevana
analyzed: sampayuttakānam ca khandhānam pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānam ca 🔽khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽pacchā jāta āsevana

original: Cetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A mental factor is a condition, as subsequent condition, for a non-mental factor. (Abbreviated.)

original: Acetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-mental factor is a condition, as subsequent condition, for a non-mental factor. (Abbreviated.)

original: Cetasiko ca acetasiko ca dhammā acetasikassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cetasikaḥ ca acetasikaḥ ca dhammā acetasikassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: A mental factor and a non-mental factor are a condition, as subsequent condition, for a non-mental factor. (Abbreviated.)

original: Cetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa āsevanapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A mental factor is a condition, as repetition condition, for a mental factor. (Abbreviated.)

original: Kamma
analyzed: kamma
translated: Kamma

original: Cetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.
analyzed: cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā
translated: A mental factor is a condition, as kamma condition, for a mental factor, for what is conascent and for what is not conascent.

original: Sahajātā—cetasikā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽…pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—cetasikā cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajātā acetasikā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe  pe nānākkhaṇikā acetasikā cetanā vipākānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascent: a mental factor, volition, is a condition, as kamma condition, for the associated aggregates. At the moment of rebirth-linking🔽… and so on with the other kinds of kamma.

original: Cetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.
analyzed: cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā
translated: A mental factor is a condition, as kamma condition, for a non-mental factor, for what is conascent and for what is not conascent.

original: Sahajātā—cetasikā cetanā cittassa cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo;🔽paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—cetasikā cetanā vipākassa cittassa kaṭattā ca
analyzed: sahajātā acetasikā cetanā cittassa citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  paṭisandhi khaṇe pe nānākkhaṇikā acetasikā cetanā vipākassa cittassa kaṭattā ca
translated: Conascent means: Conascent volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cetasiko dhammo cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā,🔽nānākkhaṇikā. translated: Non-conascent means: Conascent volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the resultant consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽A mental formation is a condition, as kamma condition, for a mental formation and for a non-mental formation, as conascent and as postnascent.🔽Conascent means: Conascent volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vipākānam khandhānam cittassa kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Non-conascent means: Conascent volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the resultant aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Vipākādi
analyzed: vipāka ādi

analyzed: paccayaḥ nava indriya paccayena paccayaḥ nava jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Condition by way of object … nine … Condition by way of faculty … nine … Condition by way of absorption … three …

original: Vippayutta
analyzed: vippayutta
translated: Dissociated

original: Cetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta
translated: A mental factor is to a non-mental factor a condition by way of non-dissociation condition: conascence, post-nascence. (Abbreviated.)

original: Acetasiko dhammo acetasikassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ,🔽pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—cittaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo;🔽paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ kaṭattārūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; cittaṁ vatthussa
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ acetasikassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta purejāta  pacchājāta sahajāta cittam citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam kaṭattā rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ cittam vatthussa
translated: A non-mental factor is to a non-mental factor a condition by way of non-dissociation condition: conascence, prenascence,🔽post-nascence. Conascence: The mind is to thoughts originated by the mind a condition by way of non-dissociation condition;

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; vatthu cittassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu cittassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhu āyatana
translated: at the time of rebirth-linking the mind is to the materiality of the kinds of generation a condition by way of non-dissociation condition; the mind is to the physical basis a condition by way of non-dissociation condition; the physical basis is to the mind a condition by way of non-dissociation condition. Prenascence: The eye-base is to eye-consciousness …

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe…🔽vatthu cittassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātaṁ—cittaṁ purejātassa imassa
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe  vatthu cittassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta cittam purejātassa imassa
translated: The physical basis is related to consciousness as a condition being not related to the arising of what is conditionally arisen.

original: kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Post-nascent states are related to this pre-nascent body as a condition being not related to the arising of what is conditionally arisen.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta
translated: A non-mental state is related to a mental state as a condition being not related to the arising of what is conditionally arisen. It is related as a pre-nascent and post-nascent condition.

original: Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu cetasikānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu cetasikānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As a pre-nascent condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the mental factors as a condition being not related to the arising of what is conditionally arisen.

original: Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ …pe… vatthu cetasikānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇa sahagatānaṃ  khandhānam pe vatthu cetasikānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As a post-nascent condition: the eye sense-sphere is related to the aggregates associated with eye-consciousness … the body sense-sphere is related to the aggregates associated with body-consciousness …🔽the physical basis is related to the mental factors as a condition being not related to the arising of what is conditionally arisen.

original: Acetasiko dhammo cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: acetasikaḥ dhammaḥ cetasikassa ca acetasikassa ca dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A non-mental state is related to a mental state and a non-mental state as a condition being not related to the arising of what is conditionally arisen. It is related as a pre-nascent and post-nascent condition.
