analyzed: ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta sahajātaḥ cakkhu viññāṇa sahagataḥ pe
translated: … and so on as in §101 up to …🔽… and so on as in §1

original: Natthipaccayena paccayo … vigatapaccayena paccayo … avigatapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: natthi paccayena paccayaḥ vigata paccayena paccayaḥ avigata paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being by way of the condition being not having … The condition being by way of the condition being having ceased … The condition being by way of the condition being not having ceased.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Numerals

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the case of cause there are three, in the case of object there are nine, in the case of predominance there are nine, in the case of proximity there are nine, in the case of contiguity there are nine, in the case of arising together there are

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte nava, pacchājāte nava,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte nava pacchājāte nava
translated: nine, in the case of mutual dependence there are nine, in the case of support there are nine, in the case of decisive support there are nine, in the case of prenascence there are nine, in the case of postnascence there are nine,

original: āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, vipāke nava (sabbattha nava), indriye nava, jhāne tīṇi,
analyzed: āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava sabbattha nava indriye nava jhāne tīṇi
translated: in the case of repetition there are nine, in the case of kamma there are three, in the case of result there are nine (in all cases nine), in the case of root there are nine, in the case of absorption there are three,

original: magge tīṇi, sampayutte pañca, vippayutte nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: magge tīṇi sampayutte pañca vippayutte nava pe avigate nava
translated: in the case of path there are three, in the case of association there are five, in the case of dissociation there are nine … and so on as in § 11 … in the case of presence there are nine.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: In the forward order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The Reversal

original: Cittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: A mind-arisen idea is a condition, by way of object condition, for a mind-arisen idea … is a condition, by way of arising together condition,

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena
translated: is a condition, by way of decisive support condition, … is a condition, by way of prenascence condition, … is a condition, by way of postnascence condition,

original: paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, by way of kamma condition.

original: Cittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …🔽sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ no citta samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A mind-produced element is related to a non-mind-produced element as object condition …🔽as co-nascence condition … as support condition … as pre-nascence condition …

original: … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as post-nascence condition … as kamma condition … as nutriment condition.

original: Cittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasamuṭṭhānassa ca nocittasamuṭṭhānassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta samuṭṭhānassa ca no citta samuṭṭhānassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo  upanissaya paccayena paccayo  purejāta paccayena
translated: A mind-produced element is related to a mind-produced element and to a non-mind-produced element as object condition …🔽as co-nascence condition … as support condition … as pre-nascence condition …

original: paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as post-nascence condition … as kamma condition.

original: Nocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ no citta samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-mind-produced element is related to a non-mind-produced element as object condition …

original: … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as co-nascence condition … as support condition … as pre-nascence condition …

original: … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as a post-nascence condition … as a nutriment condition … as a faculty condition.

original: Nocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …
analyzed: no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A mind-produced element is related to a mind-produced element as object condition …

original: sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as a co-nascence condition … as a support condition … as a pre-nascence condition …

original: … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as a post-nascence condition.

original: Nocittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasamuṭṭhānassa ca nocittasamuṭṭhānassa ca dhammassa
analyzed: no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta samuṭṭhānassa ca no citta samuṭṭhānassa ca dhammassa

analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ

original: … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as a pre-nascence condition … as a post-nascence condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Numbers

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava (sabbattha nava), noavigate nava.
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava sabbattha nava no avigate nava
translated: Pure

original: 2.10.6.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: In non-cause nine, in non-object nine (everywhere nine), in non-deprivation nine.🔽..... Reversal of Conditions in Accordance with the Direction

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi,🔽naaññamaññe dve, naupanissaye tīṇi …pe… namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte dve, navippayutte
analyzed: hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi  na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye tīṇi pe na magge tīṇi na sampayutte dve na vippayutte
translated: With respect to condition being a condition by way of object condition, there are three. With respect to condition being a condition by way of predominance condition, there are three. With respect to condition being a condition by way of proximity condition, there are three. With respect to condition being a condition by way of contiguity condition, there are three.

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to condition being a condition by way of mutuality condition, there are two. With respect to condition being a condition by way of support condition, there are three. … With respect to condition being a condition by way of path condition, there are three. With respect to condition being a condition by way of association condition, there are two. With respect to condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, there are three. With respect to condition being a condition by way of distance condition, there are three.

original: 2.10.6.7.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: ..... The Reversal Progression of Conditions

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava (anulomagaṇanā kātabbā) …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anuloma gaṇanā kātabbā pe avigate nava
translated: With respect to non-condition being a condition by way of object condition, there are nine. With respect to non-condition being a condition by way of predominance condition, there are nine. (The counting should be done in the forward order.) … With respect to non-condition being a condition by way of distance condition, there are nine.

original: Cittasamuṭṭhānadukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhāna dukam niṭṭhita
translated: The Section on the Arisen is finished.

original: 2.10.7. Cittasahabhūduka🔽2.10.7.1. Paṭiccavāra
analyzed: cittasaha bhūduka  paṭiccavāra
translated: .... The Section on Concomitant with Mind🔽... The Dependent Origination Section

original: 2.10.7.1.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: ... The Analysis Section

original: Hetu🔽Cittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— cittasahabhuṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā cittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe
analyzed: hetu  citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca citta sahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā citta sahabhu  ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhā citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe
translated: Root Cause

original: …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasahabhuṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe….
analyzed: pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe citta sahabhum ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe
translated: With mind-concomitant as condition, a mind-concomitant idea arises by way of root-cause condition: With one aggregate as condition, two aggregates … With two aggregates as condition, one aggregate … With two aggregates as condition, one aggregate … With one aggregate and one materiality-form as condition, two aggregates … With two aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, one aggregate … With one aggregate and one materiality-form as condition, one aggregate and one materiality-form … With two aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, two aggregates … With two aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, one aggregate … With two aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, one aggregate … With two aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, one aggregate and one materiality-form … With two aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, two aggregates and one materiality-form … With three aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, one aggregate … With three aggregates and one materiality-form as condition, two aggregates …

original: Cittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— cittasahabhū
analyzed: citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā citta sahabhū
translated: With a condition being a factor belonging with consciousness, there is an arising of a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, from a root-cause condition. With the condition being the factors belonging with consciousness,🔽the mind is a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, and the form that is derived from the mind is a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness. At the time of rebirth-linking,

original: khandhe paṭicca cittaṁ nocittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽cittasahabhū khandhe paṭicca cittaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ.🔽Cittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: khandhe paṭicca cittam no citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  citta sahabhū khandhe paṭicca cittam kaṭattā ca rūpa  citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā uppajjanti
translated: the factors belonging with consciousness are a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, and the form that is derived from the mind and the form that is not derived from the mind are a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness.🔽With a condition being a factor belonging with consciousness, there is an arising of a condition that is a factor belonging with consciousness and a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness,

original: hetupaccayā—cittasahabhuṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā cittañca cittasahabhu🔽ca nocittasahabhu ca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasahabhuṁ
analyzed: hetu paccayā a citta sahabhum ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhā cittam ca citta sahabhu  ca no citta sahabhu ca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe citta sahabhu
translated: from a root-cause condition. With the condition being a factor belonging with consciousness, one of the aggregates is a condition that is a factor belonging with consciousness and a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, and the form that is derived from the mind is a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness. With the condition being a factor belonging with consciousness, two of the aggregates are a condition that is a factor belonging with consciousness and a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, and the form that is derived from the mind is a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness. At the time of rebirth-linking,

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā cittañca kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe….
analyzed: ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhā cittam ca kaṭattā ca rūpa dve khandhe pe
translated: with the condition being a factor belonging with consciousness, one of the aggregates is a condition that is a factor belonging with consciousness and a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, and the form that is derived from the mind and the form that is not derived from the mind are a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness. With the condition being a factor belonging with consciousness, two of the aggregates are a condition that is a factor belonging with consciousness and a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, and the form that is derived from the mind and the form that is not derived from the mind are a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness.

original: Nocittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— cittaṁ
analyzed: no citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā citta
translated: With a condition being a factor not belonging with consciousness, there is an arising of a condition that is not a factor belonging with consciousness, from a root-cause condition. With the condition being the mind,

original: paṭicca nocittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ,
analyzed: paṭicca no citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa
translated: Dependent on a mind that is not conjoined with a mind-born material form that is a primary factor, at the moment of rebirth-linking, dependent on the mind, materiality derived from kamma,

original: cittaṁ paṭicca vatthu, vatthuṁ paṭicca cittaṁ, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… mahābhūte paṭicca🔽nocittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.🔽Nocittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— cittaṁ🔽paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā cittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: cittam paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca citte ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūte paṭicca  citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam kaṭattā rūpam  no citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca citta sahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: dependent on the mind, the physical basis, dependent on the physical basis, the mind, dependent on one great element, … dependent on the four great elements,🔽a mind-born material form that is a primary factor, materiality derived from kamma, and materiality derived from nutriment.🔽With mind as condition that is conjoined, a mind-originated material form arises, a condition by way of root condition—🔽dependent on the mind, the associated aggregates, and a mind-born material form that is a primary factor, at the moment of rebirth-linking,

original: cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā, paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū
analyzed: cittam paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca citta sahabhū
translated: dependent on the mind, the associated aggregates, at the moment of rebirth-linking, dependent on the physical basis, the aggregates that are conjoined with the mind,

original: khandhā, mahābhūte paṭicca cittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: khandhāḥ mahābhūte paṭicca citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam
translated: dependent on the great elements, a mind-born material form that is a primary factor, materiality derived from kamma, and materiality derived from nutriment.

original: Nocittasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: no citta sahabhum dhammam paṭicca citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā uppajjanti
translated: With a mind that is not conjoined as condition, a mind-originated material form arises, a condition by way of root condition—

original: hetupaccayā—cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā cittasahabhu ca nocittasahabhu ca🔽cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā
analyzed: hetu paccayā cittam paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ citta sahabhu ca no citta sahabhu ca  citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ kaṭattā
translated: With cause as condition: With consciousness as condition, the mental factors associated with it and the kinds of materiality that originate together with consciousness and are conascent with consciousness.🔽At the time of rebirth-linking, with consciousness as condition, the mental factors associated with it and the kinds of materiality originated by kamma.

original: ca rūpaṁ, paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca cittañca sampayuttakā ca khandhā, mahābhūte🔽paṭicca cittasahabhu ca nocittasahabhu ca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.🔽Cittasahabhuñca nocittasahabhuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittasahabhuṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā cittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ,🔽dve khandhe ca …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasahabhuṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca
analyzed: ca rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca cittam ca sampayuttakā ca khandhā mahābhūte  paṭicca citta sahabhu ca no citta sahabhu ca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam  citta sahabhum ca no citta sahabhum ca dhammam paṭicca citta sahabhū dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā citta sahabhu  ekam khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa  dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe citta sahabhum ekam khandhañca cittam ca paṭicca
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking, with the physical heart-basis as condition, consciousness and the mental factors associated with it. With the great primaries as condition, the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness and the kinds of materiality that are derived.

original: dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasahabhuṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca
analyzed: dve khandhā dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe citta sahabhum ekam khandhañca vatthuñca
translated: With the kinds of materiality that are conascent with consciousness and the kinds of materiality that are not conascent with consciousness as condition, a mental factor that is conascent with consciousness arises by way of condition through cause condition. With one aggregate as condition, the two aggregates … With two aggregates … With the three aggregates … At the time of rebirth-linking, with one aggregate as condition, the two aggregates … With two aggregates … With the three aggregates … At the time of rebirth-linking, with one aggregate and the physical heart-basis as condition, the two aggregates … With two aggregates and the physical heart-basis as condition, the two aggregates …

original: paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe ca …pe… cittasahabhū khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca🔽cittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: paṭicca dve khandhā dve khandhe ca pe citta sahabhū khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca  citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam
translated: With the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the great primaries as condition, the form that is derived from the great primaries.

original: Cittasahabhuñca nocittasahabhuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: citta sahabhum ca no citta sahabhum ca dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a state that is conascent with the mind and a state that is not conascent with the mind as condition, a state that is not conascent with the mind arises.

original: hetupaccayā—cittasahabhū khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca nocittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ🔽rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasahabhū khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: hetu paccayā a citta sahabhū khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca no citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhāna  rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe citta sahabhū khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: With the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the mind as condition, the form that is derived from the mind.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, with the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the mind as condition, the form that is kamma-born. At the moment of rebirth-linking,

original: cittasahabhū khandhe ca vatthuñca paṭicca cittaṁ, cittasahabhū khandhe ca mahābhūte🔽ca paṭicca nocittasahabhu cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: citta sahabhū khandhe ca vatthuñca paṭicca citta citta sahabhū khandhe ca mahābhūte  ca paṭicca no citta sahabhu citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpam
translated: with the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the physical basis as condition, the mind. With the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the great primaries as condition, the form that is not conascent with the mind and is derived from the great primaries, the form that is kamma-born, and the form that is derived from nutriment.

original: Cittasahabhuñca nocittasahabhuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū
analyzed: citta sahabhum ca no citta sahabhum ca dhammam paṭicca citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū
translated: With a state that is conascent with the mind and a state that is not conascent with the mind as condition, a state that is conascent with the mind and a state that is not conascent with the mind arise.🔽With the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the mind as condition, the form that is derived from the mind. At the moment of rebirth-linking, with the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the mind as condition, the form that is kamma-born. At the moment of rebirth-linking, with the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the physical basis as condition, the mind. With the mental factors that are conascent with the mind and the great primaries as condition, the form that is not conascent with the mind and is derived from the great primaries, the form that is kamma-born, and the form that is derived from nutriment.

translated: With No Root-Cause🔽With consciousness-born as condition, a consciousness-born states is produced by way of root-cause condition. With one of the aggregates that is consciousness-born as condition, the two aggregates that are consciousness-born and the materiality originated by consciousness are produced.

original: khandhe paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho. (Evaṁ navapi pañhā kātabbā.🔽“Ahetukan”ti niyāmetabbaṁ. Yathā anulome labbhati evaṁ kātabbaṁ. Tīṇi moho yathā
analyzed: khandhe paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho evam nava pi pañhā kātabbā  ahetukanti yathā anulome labbhati evam kātabba tīṇi mohaḥ yathā
translated: With two of the aggregates that are consciousness-born as condition, the two aggregates that are consciousness-born and the materiality originated by consciousness are produced. … With the aggregates that are consciousness-born at the rebirth-linking of those without root-cause … With the aggregates that are consciousness-born and associated with uncertainty and with agitation … With the aggregates that are consciousness-born and associated with uncertainty and with agitation as condition, the perversion of view and the perversion of uncertainty are produced. (The nine questions should be treated in the same way as in the case of the consciousness-born triad.)

original: cittasamuṭṭhānaduke evameva kātabbā.)
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhāna duke evam eva kātabbā
translated: “With no root-cause” should be construed as follows: “With no root-cause as condition, a state without root-cause is produced.” The three kinds of perversion should be treated as in the case of the consciousness-born triad.

translated: Object condition

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A state that is conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is conascent with consciousness as object condition … nine. (As in the case of the dyad “arisen from consciousness,” the only difference is that the words “as object condition” are added.)

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominance

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Ārammaṇādhipatipi sahajātādhipatipi kātabbā.)
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi sahajāta adhipati pi kātabbā
translated: A state that is conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is conascent with consciousness as predominance condition … three. (As object predominance and as co-nascence predominance.)

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is not conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is not conascent with consciousness as predominance condition … three.

original: (Ārammaṇādhipatipi sahajātādhipatipi imesampi tiṇṇaṁ kātabbā. Navapi pañhā cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisā.
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati pi sahajāta adhipati pi imesam pi tiṇṇam kātabbāḥ nava pi pañhā citta samuṭṭhāna duka sadisā
translated: (As object predominance and as co-nascence predominance.) Nine questions. As in the case of the dyad “arisen from consciousness.”

original: Ante tīṇi ārammaṇādhipatiyeva.)
analyzed: ante tīṇi
translated: Three at the end. As object predominance only.

original: Anantarādi🔽Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … nava (cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisaṁ,
analyzed: anantara ādi  citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ nava citta samuṭṭhāna duka sadisa
translated: Proximity, etc.

original: ninnānākaraṇaṁ) … samanantarapaccayena paccayo … nava (paṭiccasadisā) … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: ninna anākaraṇa samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ nava paṭicca sadisā sahajāta paccayena
translated: A state that is conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is conascent with consciousness as proximity condition … nine. (As in the case of the dyad “arisen from consciousness,” the only difference is that the words “as proximity condition” are added.) … as contiguity condition … nine. (As in the case of the dyad “arisen from consciousness,” the only difference is that the words “as contiguity condition” are added.) … as decisive-support condition … nine. (As in the case of the dyad “arisen from consciousness,” the only difference is that the words “as decisive-support condition” are added.) … as co-nascence condition …

original: paccayo … nava (paṭiccasadisā) … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nava (paṭiccasadisā)🔽… nissayapaccayena paccayo … nava (paccayavārasadisā) … upanissayapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: paccayaḥ nava paṭicca sadisā aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nava paṭicca sadisā  nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ nava paccaya vāra sadisā upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conditioned … nine (as in the Dependent Origination). … Mutually-related condition … nine (as in the Dependent Origination).🔽… Support condition … nine (as in the Conditions). … Object-predominance condition …

original: … nava. (Cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisā.)
analyzed: nava citta samuṭṭhāna duka sadisā
translated: … nine (as in the Conditioned by Mind).

original: Purejāta
analyzed: purā jāta
translated: Preceding

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ … tīṇi. (Nocittasahabhū mūlaṁyeva labbhati, cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisā.
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātam tīṇi mūlayā iva labbhati citta samuṭṭhāna duka sadisā
translated: A phenomenon that is not conascent with mind is a condition, as a preceding condition, for a phenomenon that is not conascent with mind, being respectively: a condition by object-predominance,🔽a condition by support-predominance … three. (Only the root that is not conascent with mind is obtained, as in the Conditioned by Mind and Conditioned by What is Derived from Mind.)

original: Tīṇipi ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇipi nit nānākaraṇa
translated: … three. (The three are not differentiated.)

original: Pacchājātāsevana🔽Cittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo— pacchājātā
analyzed: pacchā jāta āsevana  citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājātā
translated: Post-nascence and Repetition🔽A phenomenon that is conascent with mind is a condition, as a post-nascence condition, for a phenomenon that is not conascent with mind, being respectively: post-nascence

original: cittasahabhū khandhā purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citta sahabhū khandhā purejātassa imassa no citta sahabhussa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: conascent with mind aggregates are a condition, as a post-nascence condition, for this pre-nascent not conascent with mind body.

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo …pe….🔽Cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā nocittasahabhussa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo (saṅkhittaṁ) … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … nava.🔽Kamma🔽Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.🔽Sahajātā—cittasahabhū cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—cittasahabhū🔽cetanā vipākānaṁ cittasahabhūnaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ pe  citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā no citta sahabhussa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ nava  kamma  citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā  sahajātā a citta sahabhū cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  cetanā vipākānam citta sahabhūnam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A post-nascence condition means: a state that is not conascent with consciousness is a post-nascence condition for a state that is not conascent with consciousness.

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— sahajātā,
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā
translated: A post-nascence condition means: a state that is conascent with consciousness and a state that is not conascent with consciousness are a post-nascence condition for a state that is not with consciousness and a

original: nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū cetanā cittassa nocittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: nānā khaṇikā sahajātā a citta sahabhū cetanā cittassa no citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca
translated: are of different times. Co-nascent: The volition that is conascent with consciousness is a condition, as kamma condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness that are not conascent with consciousness.

original: rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—cittasahabhū
analyzed: rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking … are of different times. The volition that is conascent with consciousness

original: cetanā vipākassa cittassa kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cetanā vipākassa cittassa kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, as kamma condition, for resultant consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa ca nocittasahabhussa ca dhammassa kammapaccayena🔽paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽cittassa ca cittasahabhūnañca nocittasahabhūnañca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena🔽paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—cittasahabhū cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa ca no citta sahabhussa ca dhammassa kamma paccayena  paccayaḥ sahajātā nānā kkhaṇikā sahajātā a citta sahabhū cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam  cittassa ca citta sahabhūnam ca no citta sahabhūnam ca citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam kamma paccayena  paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe nānākkhaṇikā acitta sahabhū cetanā vipākānam khandhānam
translated: A state conascent with consciousness is a condition, as kamma condition, for a state conascent with consciousness and for a state not conascent with consciousness,🔽as conascent and as postnascent. Co-nascent: The volition that is conascent with consciousness is a condition, as kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness that are conascent with consciousness and not conascent with consciousness.

original: cittassa kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cittassa kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking … are of different times. The volition that is conascent with consciousness is a condition, as kamma condition, for the resultant aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Vipākādi
analyzed: vipāka ādi
translated: Resultant, etc.

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo (cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisaṁ)🔽… āhārapaccayena paccayo … nava. Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa indriyapaccayena
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ citta samuṭṭhāna duka sadisa  āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ nava citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa dhammassa indriya paccayena
translated: A dhamma that is conascent with consciousness … is related to a dhamma that is conascent with consciousness as kamma-result condition … (as above, §§171–72).

original: paccayo … nava (cittasamuṭṭhānadukasadisaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ) … jhānapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: paccayaḥ nava citta samuṭṭhāna duka sadisa jhāna paccayena paccayo
translated: … is related to a dhamma that is conascent with consciousness as nutriment condition … nine. A dhamma that is conascent with consciousness … is related to a dhamma that is conascent with consciousness as faculty condition … nine. … as jhāna condition …

original: … tīṇi … maggapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: tīṇi magga paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: three … as path condition … three … as association condition … five.

original: Vippayutta🔽Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā cittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vippayutta  citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhāḥ citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayo
translated: Dissociated🔽A dhamma that is conascent with consciousness is related to a dhamma that is conascent with consciousness as non-concomitant condition. Conascent states are related to material instances that are conascent with consciousness as non-concomitant condition.

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A dhamma that is conascent with consciousness is related to a dhamma that is not conascent with consciousness as non-concomitant condition. Conascent states are related to postnascent consciousness as non-concomitant condition.

original: pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā nocittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: pacchājāta sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhāḥ no citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ
translated: Postnascent. Co-nascent: The states associated with mind are conditionally related to the kinds of materiality originated by kamma and to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Pacchājātā—cittasahabhū khandhā🔽purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe pacchājātā a citta sahabhū khandhā  purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo
translated: Postnascence. Conascence: The mind-born materiality of the mind-born aggregates is related to the non-mind-born materiality as a condition by non-concomitance. At the moment of rebirth-linking … Postnascence: The mind-born aggregates are related to this non-mind-born body as a condition by non-concomitance.

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa ca nocittasahabhussa ca dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa ca no citta sahabhussa ca dhammassa vippayutta paccayena
translated: A mind-born state is related to a mind-born state and to a non-mind-born state as a condition by non-concomitance.

original: paccayo. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā cittasahabhūnañca nocittasahabhūnañca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ🔽rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nocittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: paccayo sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhā citta sahabhūnam ca no citta sahabhūnam ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ  rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  no citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta
translated: Conascence: The mind-born aggregates are related to the mind-born and to the non-mind-born materiality as a condition by non-concomitance.🔽A non-mind-born state is related to a non-mind-born state as a condition by non-concomitance. Conascence,

original: purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—cittaṁ nocittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: purejāta pacchājāta sahajāta cittam citta samuṭṭhānānam
translated: prenascence, and postnascence. Conascence: The mind is related to the non-mind-born materiality as a condition by non-concomitance.

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ kaṭattārūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam kaṭattā rūpānam vippayutta paccayena
translated: The condition being by way of disassociation condition, at the time of rebirth-linking, mind is for the kinds of materiality that originate with that as condition, by way of disassociation condition.

original: paccayo; cittaṁ vatthussa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; vatthu cittassa vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ cittam vatthussa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ vatthu cittassa vippayutta paccayena
translated: Mind is for the physical basis, by way of disassociation condition. The physical basis is for mind, by way of disassociation condition.

original: paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo …pe…🔽kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu cittassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātaṁ—cittaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhāyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pe  kāya āyatanam pe vatthu cittassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta citta
translated: Preceding is the eye sense-sphere for eye-consciousness …🔽… the body sense-sphere … the physical basis is for mind, by way of disassociation condition.

original: purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nocittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ,🔽purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—cittaṁ cittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo  no citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta  purejāta sahajāta cittam citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena
translated: Post-nascent is mind for this pre-arisen body that is not conascent with mind, by way of disassociation condition.🔽A non-conascent-with-mind condition is a condition, by way of disassociation condition, for a conascent-with-mind condition—conascence,🔽pre-arising. Conascence: Mind is for the kinds of materiality conascent with mind that originate with that as condition, by way of disassociation condition.

original: paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhāyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena
translated: Pre-arising: The eye sense-sphere is for the kinds of materiality associated with eye-consciousness, by way of disassociation condition.

original: paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu cittasahabhūnaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu citta sahabhūnam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition, by way of dissociation condition, for the faculties of body, … and for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with the mind.

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa ca nocittasahabhussa ca dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena🔽paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—cittaṁ cittasahabhūnañca nocittasahabhūnañca🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ🔽cakkhuviññāṇassa sampayuttakānañca rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa ca no citta sahabhussa ca dhammassa vippayutta paccayena  paccayo sahajāta purejāta sahajāta cittam citta sahabhūnam ca no citta sahabhūnam ca  citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe vatthu purejāta cakkhāyatana  cakkhu viññāṇassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatana
translated: A state that is not conascent with consciousness is a condition, by way of dissociation condition, for a state that is conascent with consciousness and for a state that is not conascent with consciousness.

original: …pe… vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascence: Consciousness is a condition, by way of dissociation condition, for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with consciousness and for the kinds of materiality that are originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking … and so on up to … It is a condition, by way of dissociation condition, for the kinds of materiality that are originated by nutriment and for the kinds of materiality that are originated by temperature. Prenascence: The eye base is a condition, by way of dissociation condition, for eye-consciousness and for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with eye-consciousness. The ear base … The nose base … The tongue base … The body base … The visible-data base … The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base … The mind base is a condition, by way of dissociation condition, for the states associated with the mind and for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with the mind.

original: Cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā cittasahabhussa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena
analyzed: citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā citta sahabhussa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena
translated: A state that is conascent with consciousness and a state that is not conascent with consciousness are a condition, by way of dissociation condition, for a state that is conascent with consciousness.

original: paccayo. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā ca cittañca cittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ🔽rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā nocittasahabhussa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena🔽paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā ca cittañca nocittasahabhūnaṁ
analyzed: paccayo sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhā ca cittam ca citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ  rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā no citta sahabhussa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena  paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhā ca cittam ca no citta sahabhūna
translated: are a condition, by way of non-co-nascence condition, for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with consciousness and are derived from the four great essentials.🔽are a condition, by way of non-co-nascence condition, for the kinds of materiality that are not conascent with consciousness and are derived from the four great essentials.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Pacchājātā—cittasahabhū🔽khandhā ca cittañca purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā cittasahabhussa ca nocittasahabhussa ca
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe pacchājātā citta sahabhūtā  khandhā ca cittam ca purejātassa imassa no citta sahabhussa kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo  citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā citta sahabhussa ca no citta sahabhussa ca
translated: are a condition, by way of non-conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality that are not conascent with consciousness and are derived from the four great essentials.🔽are a condition, by way of non-conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality that are not conascent with consciousness and are derived from the four great essentials.

original: dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—cittasahabhū khandhā ca cittañca cittasahabhūnañca
analyzed: dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ citta sahabhū khandhā ca cittam ca citta sahabhūnañca
translated: are a condition, by way of non-conascence condition, for the kinds of materiality that are not conascent with consciousness and are derived from the four great essentials.

original: nocittasahabhūnañca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: no citta sahabhūnam ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and of the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness and are conascent with consciousness, it is a condition as a dissociation condition.

original: Atthi
analyzed: atthi
translated: There is

original: Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— cittasahabhū eko khandho …pe…. (Paṭiccasadisaṁ.)🔽Cittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Cittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa ca nocittasahabhussa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—cittasahabhū eko khandho …pe…. (Paṭiccasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ citta sahabhū ekaḥ khandho pe  citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta pacchājāta  citta sahabhū dhammaḥ citta sahabhussa ca no citta sahabhussa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo citta sahabhū ekaḥ khandho pe
translated: A state conascent with consciousness is a condition, as presence condition, for a state conascent with consciousness, for one aggregate … (as in the Paṭiccasamuppāda Sutta, but substituting “presence condition” for “condition” and “as a presence condition” for “as a condition”).🔽A state conascent with consciousness is a condition, as presence condition, for a state not conascent with consciousness, for conascent … (as in the Paṭiccasamuppāda Sutta, but substituting “presence condition” for “condition” and “as a presence condition” for “as a condition”).🔽A state conascent with consciousness is a condition, as presence condition, for a state conascent with consciousness and also for a state not conascent with consciousness, for conascent … (as in the Paṭiccasamuppāda Sutta, but substituting “presence condition” for “condition” and “as a presence condition” for “as a condition”).

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo nocittasahabhussa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammaḥ no citta sahabhussa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya saṅkhitta
translated: A state not conascent with consciousness is a condition, as presence condition, for a state not conascent with consciousness, for conascent … (as in the Paṭiccasamuppāda Sutta, but substituting “presence condition” for “condition” and “as a presence condition” for “as a condition”).

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta
translated: A state that is not conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is conascent with consciousness as a condition being a presence condition.🔽Conascence, prenascence.

original: Nocittasahabhū dhammo cittasahabhussa ca nocittasahabhussa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā cittasahabhussa dhammassa atthipaccayena🔽paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—cakkhuviññāṇasahagato eko khandho ca cakkhāyatanañca
analyzed: no citta sahabhū dhammo citta sahabhussa ca no citta sahabhussa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta  citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā citta sahabhussa dhammassa atthi paccayena  paccayo sahajāta purejāta sahajātaḥ cakkhu viññāṇa sahagataḥ ekaḥ khandho ca cakkhu āyatanañca
translated: A state that is not conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is conascent with consciousness as a presence condition. Origination is related to origination as a presence condition. Origination is related to presence as a presence condition. Presence is related to presence as a presence condition.🔽A state that is not conascent with consciousness is related to a state that is conascent with consciousness and to a state that is not conascent with consciousness as a presence condition. Origination is related to origination and to presence as a presence condition. Origination is related to presence and to presence as a presence condition. Presence is related to origination and to presence as a presence condition. Presence is related to origination and to presence and to presence as a presence condition.

original: cakkhuviññāṇañca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe…. (Sabbaṁ paṭisandhiyaṁ🔽kātabbaṁ, sahajātaṁ purejātampi.)
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam ca dvinnam khandhānam pe dve khandhā ca pe sabbam paṭisandhiya  sahajātam purejātam pi
translated: A state that is conascent with consciousness and a state that is not conascent with consciousness are related to a state that is conascent with consciousness as a presence condition.🔽Origination is related to origination and to presence as a presence condition. Origination is related to presence and to presence as a presence condition. Presence is related to origination and to presence as a presence condition. Presence is related to origination and to presence and to presence as a presence condition.

original: Cittasahabhū ca nocittasahabhū ca dhammā nocittasahabhussa dhammassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: citta sahabhū ca no citta sahabhū ca dhammā no citta sahabhussa dhammassa atthi paccayena
translated: A state that is conascent with consciousness and a state that is not conascent with consciousness are related to a state that is not conascent with consciousness as a presence condition.

original: paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Sahajātā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagatā
analyzed: paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya sahajātā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatā
translated: Condition means: conascence, prenascence, postnascence, nutriment, space, and faculty. Conascence condition means: the states conascent with the eye are a condition, as conascence condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith.

original: khandhā cakkhāyatanañca cakkhuviññāṇassa atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagatā
analyzed: khandhā cakkha āyatanañca cakkhu viññāṇassa atthi paccayena paccayo pe kāya viññāṇa sahagatā
translated: Support condition means: conascence, prenascence, postnascence, nutriment, faculty. Conascence: the aggregates conascent with eye-consciousness … the aggregates conascent with body-consciousness …

original: …pe… cittasahabhū khandhā ca cittañca nocittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: pe citta sahabhū khandhāḥ ca cittam ca no citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam
translated: … the aggregates associated with mind but not conascent with mind are a support condition for the forms derived from the primary elements that are conascent with mind.

original: atthipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā ca vatthu ca cittassa atthipaccayena🔽paccayo. Sahajātā—cittasahabhū khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca nocittasahabhūnaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ🔽rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo (paṭisandhikkhaṇe tīṇipi kātabbā). Pacchājātā—cittasahabhū
analyzed: atthi paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhā ca vatthu ca cittassa atthi paccayena  paccayo sahajāta a citta sahabhū khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca no citta sahabhūnam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ  rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe kātabbā
translated: Conascence: the aggregates associated with mind and the physical basis are a support condition for mind.🔽Conascence: the aggregates associated with mind and the primary elements are a support condition for the forms derived from the primary elements that are not conascent with mind.

original: khandhā ca cittañca purejātassa imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca cittam ca purejātassa imassa no citta sahabhussa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo
translated: Postnascence: the aggregates associated with mind and mind are a support condition for this body that is not conascent with mind and is prenascent to it.

original: Pacchājātā—cittasahabhū khandhā ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa nocittasahabhussa kāyassa
analyzed: pacchājāta a citta sahabhū khandhā ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa no citta sahabhussa kāyassa

translated: Dhammas that are conascent with consciousness and dhammas that are not conascent with consciousness are a condition, as a condition of pre-arising, for dhammas that are conascent with consciousness and for dhammas that are not conascent with consciousness.

original: Suddha

original: ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe🔽…pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paṭicca🔽dve khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: ekam khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe  pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ekam khandhañca cittam ca paṭicca  dve khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpa dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna
translated: then the condition is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness, and the resultant is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness.🔽When a condition is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness, and a non-resultant is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness arises in dependence on that condition,🔽then the condition is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness, and the non-resultant is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness.🔽When a condition is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness, and a resultant and a non-resultant are both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness arise in dependence on that condition,

original: ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhā cittañca, dve khandhe …pe… (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhā cittañca dve khandhe pe
translated: then the condition is both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness, and the resultant and the non-resultant are both conjoined with consciousness and not conjoined with consciousness.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte

translated: With nine as root, nine as object, nine as dominant, nine as proximate, nine as immediately proximate, nine as conascent,

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte pañca, āsevane pañca,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte pañca āsevane pañca

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānañca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ca dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ
translated: Dependent on a state that is a result of mind-contact and a state that is not a result of mind-contact, a state that is not a result of mind-contact …🔽… arises from mind-contact that is not a condition.🔽Dependent on the states that are not a result of mind-contact and are without root-cause, and on mind,

original: dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetuke cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ca cittañca
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuke citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ca cittam ca
translated: the materiality originated by mind arises.

original: paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, ahetuke cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ca mahābhūte
analyzed: paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuke citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ca mahābhūte
translated: Dependent on the states that are not a result of mind-contact and are without root-cause, and on the great essentials,🔽the materiality originated by mind arises.

original: ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne
analyzed: ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, dependent on the states that are not a result of mind-contact and are without root-cause,🔽and on mind, the materiality due to kamma performed arises.

original: khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne
analyzed: khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, dependent on the states that are not a result of mind-contact and are without root-cause,

original: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne

original: khandhe ca vatthuñca paṭicca cittaṁ.
analyzed: khandhe ca vatthuñca paṭicca citta
translated: and on the physical basis, mind arises.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānañca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānañca dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ca dhammam paṭicca citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ
translated: Dependent on a state that is a result of mind-contact and a state that is not a result of mind-contact, a state that is a result of mind-contact …🔽… arises from mind-contact that is not a condition.

original: ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetukam citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna

analyzed: ekam khandhañca cittañca paṭicca dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe

analyzed: pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā
translated: (The two should be made in the case of rebirth-linking without root-cause.)

analyzed: na ārammaṇa  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: Not object🔽With a state that is a product of mind-contact as condition, a state that is not a product of mind-contact arises,

original: naārammaṇapaccayā—cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ;🔽paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa  paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: not as object condition. With the aggregates that are a product of mind-contact as condition, form that is a product of mind …🔽(The two should be made in the case of the rebirth-linking consciousness.)🔽With a state that is not a product of mind-contact as condition, a state that is not a product of mind-contact arises,

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati🔽naārammaṇapaccayā—cittaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati  na ārammaṇa paccayā cittam paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe citta
translated: not as object condition. With mind as condition, form that is a product of mind …

original: paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, cittaṁ paṭicca vatthu, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe…. (Yāva asaññasattā.)
analyzed: paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa cittam paṭicca vatthu ekam mahābhūtam pe yāva asaññasattā
translated: With mind as condition, the four great elements. At the moment of rebirth-linking, with mind as condition, the first two kinds of materiality that arise together with rebirth-linking consciousness; with mind as condition, the physical basis; with mind as condition, one of the great primaries … (up to … ) with mind as condition, the non-determinate formations.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānañca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno🔽dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā— cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ca cittañca🔽paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ca mahābhūte ca
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam ca dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ca cittam ca  paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ca mahābhūte ca
translated: Dependent on a state that is a result of consciousness and a state that is not a result of consciousness, there arises a state that is not a result of consciousness, not related to consciousness by way of decisive support condition …🔽Dependent on the states that are results of consciousness and consciousness, there arises materiality that is a result of consciousness. Dependent on the states that are results of consciousness and the great primaries,🔽

original: paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dve, saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe dve
translated: With a condition that is both associated with mind and arisen from the great primaries, and with a condition that is not associated with mind and arisen from the great primaries, there arises a result that is not associated with mind and arisen from the great primaries. With the faculties and with the great primaries associated with mind, there arises the corporeal-form that is associated with mind and arisen from the great primaries. With the faculties and with the great primaries that are not associated with mind, there arises the corporeal-form that is not associated with mind and arisen from the great primaries. (At the moment of rebirth two results arise.)

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Numbers

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: The Pure

original: tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane
analyzed: tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane
translated: With a condition that is not a root, there are nine. With a condition that is not an object, there are three. With a condition that is not predominance, there are nine. With a condition that is not proximity, there are three. With a condition that is not contiguity, there are three. With a condition that is not Arousal, there are three. With a condition that is not presence, there are three. With a condition that is not arising, there are three. With a condition that is not non-disappearance, there are three.

original: nava, nakamme cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne cha,
analyzed: nava na kamme cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne cha
translated: With a condition that is not kamma, there are four. With a condition that is not result, there are nine. With a condition that is not nutriment, there is one. With a condition that is not faculty, there is one. With a condition that is not path, there are six.

original: namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With a condition that is not association, there are three. With a condition that is not dissociation, there are six. With a condition that is not presence, there are three. With a condition that is not non-presence, there are three.

original: 2.10.9.1.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya

analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi

original: 2.10.9.1.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava anantare nava saṅkhitta  sahajātavāra

original: Hetu

original: …pe…. (Yāva mahābhūtā.)

analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paccayā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati

translated: With no cause as condition, there are five. With no predominance, there are five. With no prior condition, there are five. With no subsequent condition, there are five. With no development, there are five. With no kamma, there are three. With no result, there are five. With no foundation, there are five. With no path, there are five. With no dissociation, there are five.🔽2.10.9.6. Associated🔽The other two calculations and the associated class should be done in the same way.🔽2.10.9.7. Questions🔽2.10.9.7.1. Mind-contact-originated causes are a condition, as cause condition, for consciousness and for what is originated by consciousness.🔽

original: hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena
analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam cittassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena
translated: The cause is a condition, by way of condition being a cause, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: ārammaṇa  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: Object🔽A state that is associated with consciousness and originates together with consciousness is a condition, by way of object condition, for a state that is associated with consciousness and originates together with consciousness.

original: paccayo—cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ārabbha cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānā khandhā🔽uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ārabbha cittaṁ uppajjati.🔽(Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāne khandhe ārabbha cittañca sampayuttakā
analyzed: paccayaḥ citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ārabbha citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānāḥ khandhāḥ  uppajjanti mūlam kātabba citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ārabbha cittam uppajjati  mūlam kātabba citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāne khandhe ārabbha cittam ca sampayuttakā
translated: The aggregates that are associated with consciousness and originate together with consciousness arise in dependence on the aggregates that are associated with consciousness and originate together with consciousness.🔽The aggregates that are associated with consciousness and originate together with consciousness arise in dependence on consciousness.

original: ca khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: ca khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: The aggregates that are associated with consciousness and originate together with consciousness and also consciousness arise in dependence on the aggregates that are associated with consciousness and originate together with consciousness.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A state that is not associated with consciousness and does not originate together with consciousness is a condition, by way of object condition, for a state that is not associated with consciousness and does not originate together with consciousness.🔽Noble persons review the path … they review Nibbāna.

original: paccayo—ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti …pe… nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti.🔽Nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa …pe….
analyzed: paccayoariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti pe nibbānam paccavekkhanti 🔽nibbānam gotrabhussa pe
translated: Nibbāna is a condition, by way of object condition, for the path … for reviewing Nibbāna.

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominant condition

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi. (Dvepi adhipatī kātabbā.)
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi dve pi adhipatī kātabbā
translated: A state that is associated with mind and has arisen together with mind is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is associated with mind and has arisen together with mind. As object-predominant condition and as conascence-predominant condition … there are three. (The two kinds of predominant condition should be done.)

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati … tīṇi. (Dvepi adhipati kātabbā.)🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati tīṇi dve pi adhipati kātabbā  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: A state that is not associated with mind and has not arisen together with mind is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is not associated with mind and has not arisen together with mind. As object-predominant condition and as conascence-predominant condition … there are three. (The two kinds of predominant condition should be done.)

original: dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati. (Ekāyeva adhipati kātabbā,
analyzed: dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati ekāya iva adhipati kātabbā
translated: A state that is associated with mind and has arisen together with mind and a state that is not associated with mind and has not arisen together with mind are a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is associated with mind and has arisen together with mind. As object-predominant condition. (Only one kind of predominant condition should be done.)

original: navapi pañhā. Yathā cittasahabhūdukaṁ, evaṁ kātabbaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: nava api pañhāḥ yathā
translated: (The nine questions should be done as in the case of the states associated with mind that have mind as their forerunner.)

original: Anantarādi
analyzed: anantara ādi
translated: Proximity, etc.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa anantara paccayena
translated: A state that is associated with mind and has arisen together with mind is a condition, as proximity condition, for a state that is associated with mind and has arisen together with mind.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena🔽paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānaṁ
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta saṅkhitta  no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena  paccaya usahajāta purejāta sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu
translated: A state that is not originated by mind is a condition, as a dissociate condition, for a state originated by mind.🔽A state that is not originated by mind is a condition, as a dissociate condition, for a state originated by mind.

original: khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatāna  khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu  khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is not originated by mind is a condition, as a dissociate condition, for a state originated by mind.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: A state that is not originated by mind is a condition, as a dissociate condition, for a state originated by mind and for a state that is not originated by mind.

original: ca dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: ca dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta purejāta sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: and is related to mentality-materiality as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ🔽cakkhuviññāṇassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ🔽…pe… vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānaṃ vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhāyatana  cakkhu viññāṇassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānaṃ vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāya āyatana  pe vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Conascence: at the moment of rebirth-linking,🔽the physical basis is related to consciousness and to the associated aggregates as a condition by way of dissociation condition.🔽Pre-nascence: the eye-base is related to eye-consciousness and to the associated aggregates as a condition by way of dissociation condition. … The body-base is related to body-consciousness and to the associated aggregates as a condition by way of dissociation condition. … The physical basis is related to consciousness and to the associated aggregates as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: A state that is conjoined with consciousness and a state that is not conjoined with consciousness are related to a state that is not conjoined with consciousness as a condition by way of dissociation condition.🔽Conascence: post-nascence. (Abbreviated.)

A state that is associated with mind and originates together with mind is related to a state that is not associated with mind as a condition being present. (Condensed.) translated: A state that is not associated with mind is related to a state that is not associated with mind as a condition being present. (Condensed.)

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa atthi paccayena
