(Condensed.)🔽A state that is not associated with mind is related to a state that is both associated with mind and not associated with mind as a condition being present. (Condensed.)

original: paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—cittaṁ sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena
analyzed: paccaya usahajāta purejāta sahajāta cittam sampayuttakānam khandhānam atthi paccayena
translated: Support condition means: conascence, prenascence. Conascence means: mind is related to the associated aggregates as support condition.

original: paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo,🔽paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam sampayuttakānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ  paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthu citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānānam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, mind is related to the associated aggregates as support condition.

original: (Purejātaṁ—purejātasadisaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)🔽Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa🔽ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—cittaṁ sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: purejāta purejāta sadisa ninnānākaraṇa  no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa  ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta sahajāta cittam  khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, the physical basis is related to the aggregates that are conascent with and have mind as their forerunner as support condition.🔽Prenascence means: the same as prenascence, there is no difference.🔽A state that is not conascent with mind is related to a state that is conascent with mind and to a state that is not conascent with mind as support condition.🔽Conascence means: mind is related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality that are derived from mind as support condition.

original: cittaṁ sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo, paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: cittam sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, mind is related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality derived from the primary elements as support condition.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking,

analyzed: vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta purejāta sadisa  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: The basis is a condition, by way of presence condition, for the mind and for the mental factors associated with it.🔽Pre-arisen. (Similar to pre-arisen.)

original: dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—cakkhuviññāṇasahagato🔽eko khandho ca cakkhuviññāṇañca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe… cakkhuviññāṇasahagato
analyzed: dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta purejāta sahajātaḥ cakkhu viññāṇa sahagataḥ  ekaḥ khandho ca cakkhu viññāṇañca dvinnam khandhānam pe dve khandhā ca pe cakkhu viññāṇa sahagataḥ
translated: Factors that are conjoined with mind and arisen together with mind and factors that are not conjoined with mind are a condition, by way of presence condition, for factors that are conjoined with mind and arisen together with mind.🔽Conjoined with eye-consciousness and arisen together with eye-consciousness

original: eko khandho ca cakkhāyatanañca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagato🔽…pe… cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno eko khandho ca cittañca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena
analyzed: ekaḥ khandho ca cakkhu āyatanam ca dvinnam khandhānam pe dve khandhā ca pe kāya viññāṇa sahagataḥ  pe citta saṃsaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca cittam ca dvinnam khandhānam atthi paccayena
translated: one of the aggregates and eye-consciousness are a condition, by way of presence condition, for two of the aggregates … two of the aggregates and eye-consciousness are a condition, by way of presence condition, for two of the aggregates … Conjoined with body-consciousness …

original: paccayo, dve khandhā ca …pe… cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno eko khandho ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ

original: khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca pe paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa

(In the case of rebirth-linking, both should be done.)🔽A state that is not associated with mind and that has arisen together with mind and a state that has arisen together with mind and is not associated with mind are a condition, by way of presence condition, for a state that has arisen together with mind and is not associated with mind.

original: dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.🔽Sahajātā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagatā khandhā ca cakkhāyatanañca cakkhuviññāṇassa atthipaccayena🔽paccayo …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagatā …pe… cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānā khandhā ca cittañca🔽cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo, cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānā
analyzed: dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya  sahajātā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatā khandhā ca cakkhu āyatanañca cakkhu viññāṇassa atthi paccayena  paccayaḥ pe kāya viññāṇa sahagatā pe citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānā khandhā ca cittam ca  citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānā
translated: Conascence, prenascence, postnascence, nutriment, and faculty are conditions.

original: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo,
analyzed: khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ

The aggregates that are conascent with mind and the great elements are a condition, by way of presence condition, for the form that has arisen together with mind and is associated with mind.

translated: Arisen together: the one aggregate and the eye-base are conascent with the two aggregates, and they are conascent with the three aggregates.

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa ca atthi paccayena paccayaḥ dve khandhā ca pe kāya viññāṇa sahagataḥ  ekaḥ khandho ca cittam ca dvinnam khandhānam
translated: Origination-together: One aggregate and the eye-base are a condition, as presence condition, for two aggregates and for eye-consciousness. Two aggregates … and for body-consciousness.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo, dve khandhā ca …pe… cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno🔽eko khandho ca vatthu ca dvinnaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa ca atthipaccayena paccayo, dve
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ dve khandhā ca pe  ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca dvinnam khandhānam cittassa ca atthi paccayena paccayaḥ dve

original: khandhā ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā.)
analyzed: khandhā ca pe paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā

analyzed: āsevane nava kamme tīṇi vipāke nava āhāre nava indriye nava jhāne tīṇi magge

original: tīṇi, sampayutte pañca, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: tīṇi sampayutte pañca vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava vigate nava avigate nava
translated: in the five on association, in the five on dissociation, in the nine on presence, in the nine on absence, in the nine on disappearance, in the nine on non-disappearance.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: The direct order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena
translated: A state that is associated with mind and originates together with mind is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is associated with mind and originates together with mind. … It is a condition, as conascence condition, … It is a condition, as support condition, … It is a condition, as kamma condition, …🔽A state that is associated with mind and originates together with mind is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not associated with mind and originates together with mind. …

original: paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: It is a condition, as conascence condition, … It is a condition, as support condition, … It is a condition, as prenascence condition, … It is a condition, as postnascence condition, … It is a condition, as kamma condition, …🔽A state that is associated with mind and originates together with mind is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is associated with mind and originates together with mind, and also for a state that is not associated with mind and originates together with mind.

original: ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena
translated: … is related to a dhamma that is not associated with mind as a condition by way of object condition … by way of decisive support condition …

original: paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … is related to a dhamma that is not associated with mind as a condition by way of kamma condition.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena
analyzed: no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo  upanissaya paccayena paccayo  purejāta paccayena
translated: A dhamma that is not associated with mind and arisen together is related to a dhamma that is not associated with mind as a condition by way of object condition …🔽… by way of decisive support condition … by way of prenascence condition …

original: paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … by way of postnascence condition … by way of nutriment condition … by way of faculty condition.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A dhamma that is not associated with mind and arisen together is related to a dhamma that is associated with mind as a condition by way of object condition …🔽… by way of decisive support condition … by way of prenascence condition.

original: Nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: A dhamma that is not associated with mind and arisen together is related to a dhamma that is associated with mind and to a dhamma that is not associated with mind as a condition by way of object condition …

original: ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: They are conditions, as decisive support condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith.🔽The states that are conjoined with the mind and originated by the mind, and the states that are not conjoined with the mind but are originated by the mind, are conditions, as object condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith.

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: They are conditions, as decisive support condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith.🔽The states that are conjoined with the mind and originated by the mind, and the states that are not conjoined with the mind but are originated by the mind, are conditions, as object condition, for the states that are not conjoined with the mind but are originated by the mind.

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: They are conditions, as decisive support condition, for the states that are not conjoined with the mind but are originated by the mind.🔽They are conditions, as prenascence condition, for the states that are not conjoined with the mind but are originated by the mind.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno ca dhammā cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāno ca dhammā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa
translated: The states that are conjoined with the mind and originated by the mind, and the states that are not conjoined with the mind but are originated by the mind, are conditions, as object condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith.

original: ca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: ca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: and of a state that is not originated by mind-contact, is a condition as object condition. … is a condition as co-nascence condition. … is a condition as support condition.🔽… Conditioned by way of object condition,🔽… Conditioned by way of object condition,

analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  paccaya paccanīya  saṅkhyāvāra

analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava sabbattha nava no avigate nava

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava sabbattha nava anuloma mātikā

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: … Condition

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhū
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum dhammam paṭicca citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhū
translated: Dependent on a state that is a conascence condition for what is associated with consciousness, there is a state that is a conascence condition for what is associated with consciousness.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca🔽dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Yathā cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānadukaṁ
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum ekam khandham paṭicca  dve khandhā dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe yathā
translated: Dependent on a state that is a conascence condition with consciousness, a state that is a conascence condition with consciousness arises with root-cause condition …

original: evaṁ imampi dukaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: evam
translated: Dependent on one of the aggregates that is a conascence condition with consciousness, the two aggregates … the two aggregates … at the moment of rebirth-linking … (as in the case of the pair with consciousness as conascence).

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhūdukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: niṭṭhita
translated: The pair with consciousness as conascence is treated in the same way as the pair with consciousness as conascence.🔽The Section on the Pair with Consciousness as Conascence is finished.

original: 2.10.11. Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiduka🔽2.10.11.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivatti duka
translated: The Section on the Pair with Consciousness as Conascence and Postnascence🔽…🔽The Exposition of Conditions

original: Hetu🔽Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivatti
analyzed: hetu  citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivatti
translated: Root-cause condition

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā a citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim ekam khandham paṭicca
translated: Dependent on a state that is post-nascence with consciousness, a state that is post-nascence with consciousness arises with root-cause condition …

original: dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Yathā cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānadukasadisaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: dve khandhā dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe yathā
translated: Dependent on one of the aggregates that is post-nascence with consciousness, the two aggregates … the two aggregates … at the moment of rebirth-linking … (as in the case of the pair with consciousness as conascence).🔽The pair with consciousness as post-nascence is treated in the same way as the pair with consciousness as conascence.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattidukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivatti dukam niṭṭhita
translated: The dyad on what is originated by mind-contact and is related to that is finished.

original: 2.10.12. Ajjhattikaduka🔽2.10.12.1. Paṭiccavāra
analyzed: ajjhattika duka  paṭiccavāra
translated: The internal dyad🔽The dependent origination section🔽The direct order

original: 2.10.12.1.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The exposition section

original: Hetu🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā
analyzed: hetu  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca ajjhattikam kaṭattā rūpa  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā cittam paṭicca sampayuttakā
translated: Cause🔽With internal states as condition, internal states arise through the causal condition, at the stage of rebirth-linking: with consciousness as condition, the internal materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā🔽bāhiraṁ kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ.
analyzed: khandhā citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā  bāhiram kaṭattā ca
translated: With internal states as condition, external states arise through the causal condition, at the stage of rebirth-linking: with consciousness as condition, the aggregates associated with consciousness and the materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā ajjhattikañca bāhirañca kaṭattārūpaṁ.
analyzed: ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti hetu paccayā paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca kaṭattā rūpa
translated: With internal states as condition, the internal states and the external states arise through the causal condition, at the stage of rebirth-linking: with consciousness as condition, the aggregates associated with consciousness and the internal and external materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—bāhiraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ🔽paṭicca dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhiraṁ
analyzed: bāhiram dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā bāhiram ekam khandha  paṭicca dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhira
translated: With an external condition …🔽With one aggregate …🔽With two aggregates …🔽With the three aggregates …🔽With the four aggregates …🔽With the five aggregates …

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā bāhiraṁ kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… khandhe
analyzed: ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhāḥ bāhiram kaṭattā ca rūpa dve khandhe pe khandhe
translated: With the five aggregates …🔽With the four great element …🔽With the four great element …🔽With the four great element …🔽With the four great element …

analyzed: paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca khandhāḥ ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūte paṭicca citta samuṭṭhāna

original: Nahetu🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ cittaṁ🔽paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ
analyzed: na hetu  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca ajjhattikam kaṭattā rūpa  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam citta  paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe citta
translated: Without cause🔽With internal states as condition, there arises an internal state by way of object condition. At the time of rebirth-linking, with consciousness as condition, there arises materiality derived from the four great elements that is conascent with consciousness.

original: paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā bāhiraṁ kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, vicikicchāsahagataṁ uddhaccasahagataṁ🔽cittaṁ paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā bāhiram kaṭattā ca rūpa vicikicchā sahagatam uddhacca sahagata  cittam paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: With internal states as condition, there arises an external state by way of object condition. With consciousness as condition, there arise the mental factors associated with it. With consciousness as condition, there arises materiality originated by consciousness. At the time of rebirth-linking, with consciousness as condition, there arise the mental factors associated with it and the materiality of the physical basis that is derived by kamma. With consciousness as condition, there arises doubt and delusion accompanied by uncertainty.

original: cittaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā ajjhattikañca bāhirañca kaṭattārūpaṁ.
analyzed: cittam paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ ajjhattikañca bāhirañca
translated: With internal states as condition, there arise an internal state and an external state by way of object condition. At the time of rebirth-linking, with consciousness as condition, there arise the mental factors associated with it and the materiality derived from the four great elements that is conascent with consciousness.

original: Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ bāhiraṁ ekaṁ🔽khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe

translated: With an external condition being a condition, an external condition arises that is not a root condition. With a condition that is not a root condition, an external condition arises that is not a root condition. With one external condition that is not a root condition …🔽With one external condition that is not a root condition, two conditions arise that are not root conditions: with the condition being the four mental aggregates, the form that is part of the mental factors arises. With the condition being two aggregates …🔽At the stage of rebirth-linking …

original: …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato🔽uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: pe yāva asaññasattā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ  uddhacca sahagataḥ moho

original: Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā— paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā—cittaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca bāhiraṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti naārammaṇapaccayā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paṭicca ajjhattikañca bāhirañca kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā—bāhire khandhe
analyzed: ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca ajjhattikam kaṭattā rūpa  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ dhammo uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā cittam paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca bāhiram kaṭattā rūpa  ajjhattikam dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam paṭicca ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca kaṭattā rūpa  bāhiram dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā bāhire khandhe
translated: A factor belonging to one’s own continuum arises in dependence on a factor belonging to one’s own continuum, not as object condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking, consciousness conditions the materiality of the heart-basis belonging to one’s own continuum.🔽A factor belonging to another’s continuum arises in dependence on a factor belonging to one’s own continuum, not as object condition: consciousness conditions the materiality originated by consciousness belonging to another’s continuum. At the moment of rebirth-linking, consciousness conditions the materiality of the heart-basis belonging to another’s continuum.🔽Factors belonging to one’s own continuum and another’s continuum arise in dependence on a factor belonging to one’s own continuum, not as object condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking, consciousness conditions the materiality of the heart-basis belonging to one’s own continuum and to another’s continuum.🔽A factor belonging to another’s continuum arises in dependence on a factor belonging to another’s continuum, not as object condition: the aggregates belonging to another’s continuum condition the materiality originated by consciousness belonging to another’s continuum.

original: paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhire khandhe paṭicca bāhiraṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ,
analyzed: paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhire khandhe paṭicca bāhiram kaṭattā rūpa
translated: With an internal condition … (as in §1) … With an internal condition … an external condition arises … With an internal condition … an internal and an external condition arise … With an external condition … an external condition arises … With an external condition … an internal condition arises … With an external condition … an internal and an external condition arise …

original: bāhire khandhe paṭicca vatthu, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe…. (Yāva asaññasattā.)
analyzed: bāhire khandhe paṭicca vatthu ekam mahābhūtam pe yāva asaññasattā
translated: With an external base as condition, the four great elements. (Up to:) With an external base as condition, the four great elements.

original: Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā— paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhire khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti naārammaṇapaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhire khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikañca bāhirañca kaṭattārūpaṁ.🔽Ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittañca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ.
analyzed: bāhiram dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhire khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikam kaṭattā rūpa  bāhiram dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhire khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca kaṭattā rūpa  ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam ca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikam kaṭattā rūpa
translated: With an external condition, an internal condition arises, not as object condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking, with the external aggregates as condition, the internal materiality of the physical heart-basis.🔽With an external condition, an internal and an external condition arise, not as object condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking, with the external aggregates as condition, the internal and the external materiality of the physical heart-basis.🔽With an internal and an external condition, an internal condition arises, not as object condition: at the moment of rebirth-linking, with consciousness and the associated aggregates as condition, the internal materiality of the physical heart-basis.

original: Ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā—bāhire
analyzed: ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca dhammam paṭicca bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccaya abāhire
translated: With an internal and an external condition, an external condition arises, not as object condition: with the internal and the external aggregates as condition, the external materiality of the physical heart-basis.

original: khandhe ca cittañca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, cittañca mahābhūte ca paṭicca
analyzed: khandhe ca cittam ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa cittam ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca
translated: With mentality-materiality and consciousness as condition, a formation that has arisen through consciousness. With consciousness and the great essentials as condition,

original: cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe dve kātabbā.)
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe dve kātabbā
translated: a formation that has arisen through consciousness. (At the moment of rebirth two should be constructed.)

original: Ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti
analyzed: ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca dhammam paṭicca ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti
translated: With an internal and an external as condition, an internal and an external dhammas arise.

original: naārammaṇapaccayā—paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittañca sampayuttake ca khandhe paṭicca ajjhattikañca

original: bāhirañca kaṭattārūpaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bāhirañca
translated: and an external formation that has arisen through consciousness. (In brief.)

original: Najhāna🔽Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati najhānapaccayā— cakkhuviññāṇaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā …pe… kāyaviññāṇaṁ …pe….🔽Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bāhiro dhammo uppajjati najhānapaccayā— cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ

translated: With non-cause as condition, nine. With non-object as condition, nine. With non-predominance as condition, nine. With non-deprivation as condition, nine.

original: nava, nasampayutte nava, navippayutte pañca, nonatthiyā nava, novigate nava.
analyzed: nava na sampayutte nava na vippayutte pañca no natthiyā nava no vigate nava
translated: With non-association as condition, nine. With non-dissociation as condition, five. With non-deprivation as condition, nine. With non-possession as condition, nine.

original: khandhā. Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—bāhire
analyzed: khandhāḥ bāhiram dhammam paccayā ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā bāhire
translated: the internal sense-spheres. A phenomenon that is external to the mind-element and mind-consciousness-element is a condition, as object condition, for the mind-element and mind-consciousness-element.

original: khandhe paccayā cittaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā cittaṁ (paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi kātabbā).🔽Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti ārammaṇapaccayā—vatthuṁ
analyzed: khandhe paccayā citta vatthum paccayā cittam paṭisandhi khaṇe dve pi kātabbā  bāhiram dhammam paccayā ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti ārammaṇa paccaya vatthu
translated: The internal sense-spheres are a condition, as object condition, for the mind-element and mind-consciousness-element. (In the case of rebirth-linking, both should be done.)

original: paccayā cittañca sampayuttakā ca khandhā. (Paṭisandhikkhaṇe ekaṁ kātabbaṁ.)🔽Ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagate🔽khandhe ca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagate …pe….
analyzed: paccayā cittam ca sampayuttakā ca khandhā paṭisandhi khaṇe ekam kātabba  ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca dhammam paccayā ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagate  khandhe ca cakkha āyatanam ca paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya viññāṇa sahagate pe
translated: A phenomenon that is external to the mind-element and mind-consciousness-element is a condition, as object condition, for the mind-element and mind-consciousness-element and for the associated aggregates. (In the case of rebirth-linking, one should be done.)🔽An internal and an external phenomenon are a condition, as object condition, for an internal phenomenon: the eye-sensitivity that is associated with eye-consciousness and the eye-sensitivity that is not associated with eye-consciousness are a condition, as object condition, for eye-consciousness and for the states associated with eye-consciousness. (In the case of rebirth-linking, one should be done.) Body-consciousness and the states associated with body-consciousness are a condition, as object condition, for the body-sensitivity that is associated with body-consciousness and for the states associated with body-consciousness. (In the case of rebirth-linking, one should be done.)

original: Ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammaṁ paccayā bāhiro dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ
analyzed: ajjhattikam ca bāhiram ca dhammam paccayā bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagata
translated: An internal and an external phenomenon are a condition, as object condition, for an external phenomenon: the eye-sensitivity that is associated with eye-consciousness and the eye-sensitivity that is not associated with eye-consciousness are a condition, as object condition, for eye-consciousness and for the states associated with eye-consciousness. (In the case of rebirth-linking, one should be done.)

original: ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca cakkhuviññāṇañca paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe🔽…pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagataṁ …pe… bāhiraṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cittañca paccayā dve khandhā,
analyzed: ekam khandhañca cakkha āyatanañca cakkhu viññāṇañca paccayā dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe  pe kāya viññāṇa sahagatam pe bāhiram ekam khandhañca cittam ca paccayā dve khandhā
translated: With one of the aggregates and the eye-base and eye-consciousness as condition, two aggregates …🔽… with mind-element and mind-consciousness-element …🔽… with one of the external bases and mind as condition, two aggregates …

original: dve khandhe …pe… cittañca vatthuñca paccayā bāhirā khandhā (paṭisandhikkhaṇe dvepi

translated: … with mind and the physical basis as condition, the external aggregates … (at the rebirth-linking moment, both should be done.)

original: kātabbā). Ajjhattikañca bāhirañca dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā🔽uppajjanti ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca

translated: With an internal and an external as condition, an internal and an external …🔽With one of the aggregates associated with eye-consciousness and the eye-base and eye-consciousness as condition, two aggregates …

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Numbers

original: Suddha🔽Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: suddha  hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā pañca anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: Pure

original: nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte nava, āsevane nava,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte nava āsevane nava
translated: With cause as condition, nine; with object as condition, nine; with predominance as condition, five; with proximity as condition, nine; with contiguity as condition, nine; with arising together as condition, nine; with dependence as condition, nine; with non-disappearance as condition, nine; with the past as condition, nine; with the future as condition, nine; with the present as condition, nine; with the unformed as condition, nine; with the conditioned as condition, nine; with the seen as condition, nine; with the heard as condition, nine; with the sensed as condition, nine; with the cognized as condition, nine.

original: kamme nava (sabbattha nava), avigate nava.
analyzed: kamme nava sabbattha nava avigate nava
translated: in the case of the action, nine (in all cases nine), in the case of the unspecific, nine.

original: 2.10.12.3.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya
translated: ..... Condition and condition-result

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Section on Analysis

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a root

original: Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ paccayā ajjhattikaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ, cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ.
analyzed: ajjhattikam dhammam paccayā ajjhattikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe cittam paccayā ajjhattikam cakkhu āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa
translated: Conditioned by an internal condition, an internal condition arises by way of not a root condition: At the time of rebirth-linking, the internal materiality of the heart-basis conditioned by consciousness is not a root condition. The eye base conditioned by eye-consciousness is not a root condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Enumeration

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare nava, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava na anantare nava na samanantare
translated: In the case of not a root, nine; in the case of not an object, nine; in the case of not predominance, nine; in the case of not proximity, nine; in the case of not contiguity, nine;

original: nava, naaññamaññe nava, naupanissaye nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane🔽nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke pañca, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne nava, namagge
analyzed: nava na aññamaññe nava na upanissaye nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane  nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke pañca na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne nava na magge
translated: in the case of not conascence, nine; in the case of not mutuality, nine; in the case of not support, nine; in the case of not prenascence, nine; in the case of not postnascence, nine; in the case of not nutriment, nine;🔽in the case of not faculty, one; in the case of not jhana, nine; in the case of not path, nine;

original: nava, nasampayutte nava, navippayutte pañca, nonatthiyā nava, novigate nava.
analyzed: nava na sampayutte nava na vippayutte pañca no natthiyā nava no vigate nava
translated: in the case of not association, nine; in the case of not non-causality, five; in the case of not presence, nine; in the case of not disappearance, nine.

original: 2.10.12.4. Nissayavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāra
translated: ..... The Section on Support

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.

translated: The other two enumerations and the section on support should be done in the same way.

original: 2.10.12.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra🔽2.10.12.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: sa saṭṭhavāra  paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: 2.10.12.5. The section on the mixed🔽…. The condition by way of the conditions in forward order, etc.

original: Ajjhattikaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho bāhiro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—cittaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā sampayuttakā khandhā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe cittaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā sampayuttakā khandhā.🔽Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho bāhiro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—bāhiraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ
analyzed: ajjhattikam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā cittam sa saṭṭhāḥ sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe cittam sa saṭṭhāḥ sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ  bāhiram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā bāhiram ekam khandha
translated: A mixed internal condition is related to a mixed external condition as a condition by way of the condition being a cause condition—the mind is related to the associated conditions. At the time of rebirth-linking, the mind is related to the associated conditions.

original: saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho
analyzed: sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe bāhiram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ

original: ajjhattiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—bāhire khandhe saṁsaṭṭhaṁ cittaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽…pe…. Bāhiraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—bāhiraṁ
analyzed: ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā bāhire khandhe sa saṭṭham citta paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  pe bāhiram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā bāhira
translated: A mixed external condition is related to an internal condition as a condition by way of the condition being a cause condition—the mind is related to the aggregates that are mixed with the external aggregates. At the time of rebirth-linking, …

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā cittañca, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā dve khandhā cittam ca dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe

Two of the aggregates are related to two of the aggregates and to the mind. … At the time of rebirth-linking, …🔽…

original: Bāhiro dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—bāhirā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ bāhirāḥ hetū sampayuttakāna
translated: An external states is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an external state.🔽External roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for associated states.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo— paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhirā🔽hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ bāhirānañca kaṭattārūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhirā  hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam bāhirānam ca kaṭattā rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An external state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an external state. The external roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽At the moment of rebirth-linking, the external roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed.

original: Bāhiro dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—bāhirā hetū cittassa
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ bāhirāḥ hetū cittassa
translated: An external state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an internal state. The external roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for consciousness.

original: hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhirā hetū cittassa ajjhattikānañca kaṭattārūpānaṁ🔽hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Bāhiro dhammo ajjhattikassa ca bāhirassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— bāhirā
analyzed: hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhirāḥ hetū cittassa ajjhattikānaṃ ca kaṭattā rūpānaṃ  hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa ca bāhirassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ bāhirā
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, the external roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for consciousness and for the kinds of materiality due to consciousness.

original: hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena
analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam cittassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena
translated: An external state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an internal and an external state. The external roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for consciousness and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe bāhirā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittassa ca ajjhattikānañca
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe bāhirāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam cittassa ca ajjhattikānañca
translated: are conditions, as decisive support conditions, for the internal resultant aggregates and for consciousness at the rebirth-linking moment.🔽🔽The external causes are conditions, as decisive support conditions, for the internal resultant aggregates and for consciousness at the rebirth-linking moment.

original: bāhirānañca kaṭattārūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: bāhirānam ca kaṭattā rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An external cause is a condition, as a condition by way of a condition being a cause, for the internal aggregates and for consciousness and for the internal and external secondary form that is its companion at the time of rebirth-linking.

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Ajjhattiko dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—cittaṁ ārabbha
analyzed: ārammaṇa  ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya ucittam ārabbha
translated: Object

original: cittaṁ uppajjati. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.) Cittaṁ ārabbha bāhirā khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: cittam uppajjati mūlam pucchitabba cittam ārabbha bāhirāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: An internal state is a condition, as a condition by way of object condition, for an internal state: Consciousness arises in dependence on mind. (The root should be asked about.) In dependence on mind, the external aggregates arise.

original: (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.) Cittaṁ ārabbha cittañca sampayuttakā ca khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: mūlam pucchitabba cittam ārabbha cittam ca sampayuttakā ca khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: (The root should be asked about.) In dependence on mind, consciousness and the aggregates that are its companions arise.

original: Bāhiro dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe…🔽uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo …pe…
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udānam pe sīlam pe  uposatha kammam katvā tam paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ pe
translated: An external state is a condition, as a condition by way of object condition, for an external state: Generosity … virtue …🔽having performed the Uposatha observances, he reviews them and finds satisfaction and great delight in them. In dependence on that, lust …

original: domanassaṁ uppajjati; pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati, jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ …pe…
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam pe
translated: grief arises. He reviews the good deeds he has done in the past. Having emerged from jhāna, he reviews the jhāna. …

original: ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ …pe… phalaṁ …pe… nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti … nibbānaṁ
analyzed: ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam pe phalam pe nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbāna
translated: having emerged from the noble paths, they review the path … they review fruition … they review Nibbāna …

original: gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: the reviewing of the support, the reviewing of the object condition.

Cetopariyañāṇena🔽bāhiracittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānāti, ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanassa …pe… ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ
analyzed: ariyāḥ bāhire pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti vikkhambhite kilese pe pubbe samudāciṇṇe  kilese jānanti rūpe pe vatthum bāhire khandhe aniccato pe domanassam uppajjati  dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena  bāhira citta samaṅgissa cittam jānāti ākāsānañcāyatanam viññāṇañcāyatanassa pe ākiñcaññāyatana
translated: Noble ones review external states that have been abandoned … that have been suppressed … that have been previously experienced …

original: paccayo …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ …pe… bāhirā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,🔽pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.

original: Bāhiro dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ🔽…pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha cittaṁ

translated: Dominance🔽An internal condition is a condition, as predominance condition, for an internal condition. Predominance as object: having given importance to consciousness, consciousness arises.

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—cittaṁ garuṁ katvā bāhirā khandhā uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—cittādhipati
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati cittam garum katvā bāhirāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati citta adhipati
translated: An internal condition is a condition, as predominance condition, for an external condition. Predominance as object: having given importance to consciousness, the external aggregates arise. Predominance as conascence: the predominance of consciousness

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, as predominance condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the great primaries.

original: (Mūlaṁ.) Ārammaṇādhipati—ajjhattikaṁ cittaṁ garuṁ katvā cittañca sampayuttakā ca khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: mūle ārammaṇa adhipati ajjhattikam cittam garum katvā cittam ca sampayuttakā ca khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: (Root) A state that is an object condition is a condition, as object condition, for associated and for resultant great primaries.

original: Bāhiro dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ datvā …pe… tīṇi. (Dve adhipatī tiṇṇampi kātabbā.)
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati dānam da tvā pe tīṇi dve adhipatī tiṇṇam pi kātabbā
translated: An external state is a condition, as object condition, for an external state, as object condition, and as conascence condition. As object condition: having given a gift … the three. (The two object conditions should be done for all three.)

original: Ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā ajjhattikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Tiṇṇampi ekāyeva adhipati.)
analyzed: ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā ajjhattikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi tiṇṇam pi ekāya iva adhipati
translated: An internal and an external state is a condition, as object condition, for an internal state … the three. (For all three there is only one object condition.)

original: Anantarādi🔽Ajjhattiko dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimaṁ purimaṁ cittaṁ pacchimassa pacchimassa cittassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: anantara ādi  ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimam purimam cittam pacchimassa pacchimassa cittassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Immediately preceding, etc.🔽An internal state is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for an internal state: preceding consciousness is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for succeeding consciousness … the three.

original: Bāhiro dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā bāhirā
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā bāhirā
translated: An external state is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for an external state: preceding external …

original: khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; anulomaṁ gotrabhussa
analyzed: khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa
translated: The preceding aggregates are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the succeeding aggregates. The conformity-knowledge is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the change-of-lineage-knowledge. …

original: …pe… tīṇi. (Tiṇṇampi ekasadisā.)
analyzed: tīṇi tiṇṇam pi eka sadisā
translated: … three. (The three are the same as the above.)

original: Ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā ajjhattikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo🔽… tīṇi, samanantarapaccayena paccayo … nava, sahajātapaccayena paccayo … nava (paṭiccasadisā),
analyzed: ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā ajjhattikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo  tīṇi samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ nava sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ nava paṭicca sadisā
translated: An internal and an external condition is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for an internal condition …

original: aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … pañca (paṭiccasadisā), nissayapaccayena paccayo … nava.
analyzed: aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ pañca paṭicca sadisāḥ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: … three. (The three are the same as the above.) … nine. (The nine are the same as the above.) … nine. (The nine are the same as the above.) … five. (The five are the same as the above.) … nine.

original: (Paccayavārasadisā.)
analyzed: paccaya vāra sadisā
translated: (The nine are the same as the above.)

original: Upanissaya
analyzed: upanissaya
translated: Support

original: Ajjhattiko dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: An internal condition is a condition, by way of support condition, for an internal condition: support as object,

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—cittaṁ cittassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Bāhiro dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ cittam cittassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi 🔽bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: support as proximity, support as natural, … support as natural: the mind is a condition, by way of support condition, for the mind … three.

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ🔽deti …pe… mānaṁ jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti; sīlaṁ …pe… senāsanaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti🔽…pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati; saddhā …pe… senāsanaṁ saddhāya …pe… phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo. (Tīṇipi pūretvā kātabbā, cittassāti kātabbā, sampayuttakānañcāti kātabbā.)🔽Ajjhattiko ca bāhiro ca dhammā ajjhattikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ saddham upanissāya dāna  deti pe mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti sīlam pe senāsanam upanissāya dānam deti  pe saṅgham bhindati saddhā pe senāsanam saddhāya pe phala samāpattiyā upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ pūretvā kātabbā cittassa ati kātabbā sampayuttakānam ca ati kātabbā  ajjhattikaḥ ca bāhiraḥ ca dhammā ajjhattikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: the immediately preceding support condition, the natural support condition …

original: Purejāta🔽Ajjhattiko dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… kāyaṁ aniccato …pe… vipassati, assādeti
analyzed: purā jāta 🔽ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta 🔽vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe kāyam aniccataḥ pe vipassati assādeti
translated: The natural support condition: because of faith he gives a gift … he makes an effort … he has a thought … he makes a choice. Because of virtue … because of generosity … because of learning … because of understanding … because of shame … because of moral dread … because of energy … because of patience … because of truthfulness … because of determination … because of loving kindness … because of equanimity … because of the earth … because of the water … because of the fire … because of the air … because of the space … because of the consciousness … because of the base of infinite space … because of the base of infinite consciousness … because of the base of nothingness … because of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception … because of this world … because of the other world … because of what is seen … because of what is heard … because of what is sensed … because of what is known … he gives a gift … he makes an effort … he has a thought … he makes a choice. Because of the fruit … because of the path … because of the attainment of the fruit … because of the attainment of the path … because of the attainment of cessation … because of the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception … because of the attainment of the base of nothingness … because of the attainment of the base of infinite consciousness … because of the attainment of the base of infinite space … because of the attainment of the fourth jhāna … because of the attainment of the third jhāna … because of the attainment of the second jhāna … because of the attainment of the first jhāna … he gives a gift … he makes an effort … he has a thought … he makes a choice. Because of the first absorption … because of the second absorption … because of the third absorption … because of the fourth absorption … because of the attainment of the base of infinite space … because of the attainment of the base of infinite consciousness … because of the attainment of the base of nothingness … because of the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception … because of the attainment of the cessation … he gives a gift … he makes an effort … he has a thought … he makes a choice. Because of the fruit … because of the path … because of the attainment of the fruit … because of the attainment of the path … because of the attainment of cessation … because of the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non

original: abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha cittaṁ uppajjati. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: abhinandati tam ārabbha cittam uppajjati vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: He delights in that, and consciousness arises in dependence on that. The condition being by way of prenascence condition is: the eye sense-sphere is prenascent condition for eye-consciousness,

original: …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ajjhattiko dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… kāyaṁ aniccato …pe… vipassati, assādeti🔽…pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa purejāta paccayena paccayo  ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe kāyam aniccataḥ pe vipassati assādeti  pe domanassam uppajjati vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatāna  khandhānam pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … the body sense-sphere is prenascent condition for body-consciousness.

original: Ajjhattiko dhammo ajjhattikassa ca bāhirassa ca dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… kāyaṁ aniccato …pe… vipassati, taṁ
analyzed: ajjhattikaḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa ca bāhirassa ca dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta 🔽vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe kāyam aniccataḥ pe vipassati
translated: An internal condition is prenascent condition for an external condition: the condition being by way of prenascence condition is: the condition being by way of prenascence condition is: the eye … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind … the body … the mind …

original: ārabbha cittañca sampayuttakā khandhā ca uppajjanti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: ārabbha cittam ca sampayuttakā khandhā ca uppajjanti vatthu purejāta cakkhāyatana
translated: and consciousness and the associated aggregates arise. The physical basis as the prior condition: the eye sense-sphere …

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa sampayuttakānañca🔽khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānaṃ pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca  khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: the body sense-sphere is the prior condition for body-consciousness and for the associated aggregates.

original: Bāhiro dhammo bāhirassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ, vatthupurejātaṁ.🔽Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—rūpe …pe… phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati;🔽dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ bāhirassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta vatthu purejāta  ārammaṇa purejāta rūpe pe phoṭṭhabbe vatthum aniccato pe domanassam uppajjati  dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti vatthu purejāta vatthu
translated: The external is the prior condition for the external: the object as the prior condition, the physical basis as the prior condition.

original: bāhirānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: bāhirānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The object as the prior condition: in regard to form … in regard to sound … in regard to a tangible object … the physical basis as the prior condition: the physical basis is the prior condition, in relation to the external aggregates, for the arising of the faculties.

original: Bāhiro dhammo ajjhattikassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,
analyzed: bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta
translated: The external is the prior condition for the internal: the object as the prior condition,

original: vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—rūpe …pe… phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… taṁ🔽ārabbha cittaṁ uppajjati. Dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ🔽suṇāti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu cittassa purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Bāhiro dhammo ajjhattikassa ca bāhirassa ca dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—rūpe …pe… phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… taṁ
analyzed: vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta rūpe pe phoṭṭhabbe vatthum aniccato pe tad  ārabbha cittam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā sadda  suṇāti vatthu purejāta vatthu cittassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ  bāhiraḥ dhammaḥ ajjhattikassa ca bāhirassa ca dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta rūpe pe phoṭṭhabbe vatthum aniccato pe tad
translated: The physical basis is prior to the mind element and mind-consciousness element. The object is prior to the mind element and mind-consciousness element. The physical basis is prior to the mind element and mind-consciousness element.🔽The external element is a condition, as a prior condition, for the internal element and for the external element. The object is prior to the mind element and mind-consciousness element. The physical basis is prior to the mind element and mind-consciousness element.

original: ārabbha cittañca sampayuttakā khandhā ca uppajjanti. Dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati,🔽dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānañca🔽khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārabbha cittam ca sampayuttakā khandhā ca uppajjanti dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati 🔽dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti vatthu purejāta vatthu cittassa sampayuttakānam ca 🔽khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
