translated: With respect to not as root cause, there are five. With respect to not as object, there are three. With respect to not as predominance, there are five. With respect to not as antecedent, there are three. With respect to not as proximity, there are three. With respect to not as Arouser, there are three. With respect to not as Nurture, there are three. With respect to not as Determinate, there are three. With respect to not as Associated, there are three. With respect to not as Dissociated, there are three. With respect to not as presence, there are three. With respect to not as absence, there are three.

translated: With respect to not as object, there are three. With respect to not as predominance, there are five. With respect to not as kamma, there is one. With respect to not as result, there are three. With respect to not as nutriment, there are three. With respect to not as faculty, there are three. With respect to not as path, there are three. With respect to not as association, there are three. With respect to not as dissociation, there are one. With respect to not as presence, there are three. With respect to not as absence, there are three.

analyzed: upādā dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā cakkhu āyatanam paccayā
translated: With an object that is subject to cankers as condition, an object not subject to cankers arises, by way of object condition. The eye base is a condition for eye-consciousness.

original: cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā noupādā khandhā;

translated: The ear base … The nose base … The tongue base … The body base is a condition for body-consciousness. The physical basis is a condition for the aggregates not subject to cankers.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe pe

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā … ekaṁ. (Paṭiccasadisaṁ.)🔽Upādā dhammañca noupādā dhammañca dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ

translated: With an object not subject to cankers as condition, an object not subject to cankers arises, by way of object condition … one. (Similar to the Dependent Origination.)

original: ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagataṁ
analyzed: ekam khandhañca cakkhu āyatanañca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe kāya viññāṇa sahagata
translated: With an object that is subject to cankers and an object not subject to cankers as condition, an object not subject to cankers arises, by way of object condition. With one aggregate that is subject to cankers and the eye base as condition, three aggregates … two aggregates …

analyzed: pe no upādāḥ ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Numbers

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte🔽pañca, aññamaññe pañca, nissaye pañca, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi,
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā pañca anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte  pañca aññamaññe pañca nissaye pañca upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi
translated: As to cause: five. As to object: three. As to predominance: five. As to proximity: three. As to contiguity: three. As to presence:🔽five. As to presence and absence: five. As to support: five. As to decisive support: three. As to prenascence: three. As to repetition: three.

original: kamme pañca …pe… avigate pañca. (Evaṁ gaṇetabbaṁ.)🔽Nahetvādi🔽Upādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā🔽cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā ahetukā noupādā🔽khandhā; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… vatthuṁ paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: kamme pañca pe avigate pañca evam  na hetu ādi  upādā dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā cakkhu āyatanam paccayā  cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā ahetukā no upādā  khandhāḥ ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe vatthum paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: With respect to cause, there are five; with respect to object, there are three; with respect to predominance, there are five; with respect to proximity, there are three; with respect to contiguity, there are three; with respect to arising together, there are five; with respect to conascence, there are five; with respect to dependence, there are five; with respect to decisive support, there are three; with respect to not fainting, there are three; with respect to arising before, there are three; with respect to repetition, there are three; with respect to kamma, there are five; with respect to nutriment, there are five; with respect to faculty, there are five; with respect to jhāna, there are five; with respect to path, there are five; with respect to association, there are five; with respect to dissociation, there are five; with respect to presence, there are five; with respect to absence, there are five; with respect to disappearance, there are five; with respect to non-disappearance, there are five. (To be worked out in detail in the same way as the profitable by way of the remaining causal coefficients.)

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ noupādā ekaṁ🔽khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe
analyzed: no upādāḥ dhammam paccayā no upādāḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam no upādāḥ eka 🔽khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ no upādā ca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam pe dve khandhe
translated: With respect to non-cause, etc.: With a non-cause as condition there arises a non-cause dhammas. With the eye base as condition there arises eye-consciousness element and the states associated therewith. With the ear base … nose base … tongue base … body base … With the form base … the sound base … the odour base … the flavour base … the tangible-object base as condition there arises body-consciousness element and the states associated therewith. With the states associated with eye-consciousness as condition there arises eye-sensitivity that has arisen together with consciousness. With the states associated with ear-consciousness … With the states associated with body-consciousness as condition there arises body-sensitivity that has arisen together with consciousness. original: …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) vicikicchāsahagate
analyzed: pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe ekam mahābhūtam pe yāva asaññasattā vicikicchā sahagate
translated: … and at the linking of conditions at the moment of rebirth … one great primary … (up to) … in the non-percipient beings … with uncertainty …

original: uddhaccasahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho. (Tīṇipi🔽paṭiccasadisā, ninnānākaraṇā.)🔽Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… kāyaviññāṇasahagataṁ🔽…pe… ahetukaṁ noupādā ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe
analyzed: uddhacca sahagate khandhe paccayāḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho tīṇi pi  paṭicca sadisā ninnānākaraṇā  upādā ca no upādā ca dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagata  ekam khandhañca cakkhu āyatanañca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe kāya viññāṇa sahagata  pe ahetukam no upādāḥ ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe
translated: with agitation … the aggregates that are associated with uncertainty and with agitation are conditions, as root-cause condition, for the uncertainty and for the agitation and for the associated ignorance. (Three times with the three aggregates.)🔽With and without determinations as condition, a state without determinations arises, as root-cause condition. Eye-consciousness element and the states associated with it are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the three aggregates that are its support. The two aggregates … Body-consciousness element and the states associated with it …

original: ca …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca🔽paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: ca pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca  paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: without root-cause and without determinations are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the three aggregates that are its support. The two aggregates … At the moment of rebirth … with uncertainty … with agitation … the aggregates that are associated with uncertainty and with agitation and the physical basis are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the uncertainty and for the agitation and for the associated ignorance.

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā tīṇi, naāsevanapaccayā pañca.
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi na āsevana paccayā pañca
translated: As object condition, three lines. As repetition condition, five lines.

original: Nakammādi
analyzed: na kamma ādi
translated: As kamma condition, etc.

original: Upādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā noupādā cetanā.🔽Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā—noupādā khandhe paccayā
analyzed: upādā dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammo uppajjati na kamma paccayā vatthum paccayā no upādā cetanā  no upādā dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati na kamma paccayā no upādā khandhe paccayā
translated: With a clinging-aggregate as condition, a non-clinging-aggregate arises: with the materiality of the physical basis as condition, the non-clinging volition.

original: sampayuttakā cetanā; bāhiraṁ āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ utusamuṭṭhānaṁ …pe… dve mahābhūte paccayā dve mahābhūtā.
analyzed: sampayuttakā cetanā bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam pe dve mahābhūte paccayā dve mahābhūtā
translated: With a non-clinging-aggregate as condition, a non-clinging-aggregate arises: with the non-clinging aggregates as condition, the non-clinging volition associated therewith. With the external as condition, the great primaries originating from nutriment, the great primaries originating from temperature, … the two great primaries.

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā upādā dhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā—bāhire āhārasamuṭṭhāne utusamuṭṭhāne mahābhūte paccayā upādārūpaṁ.🔽Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā uppajjanti nakammapaccayā— bāhiraṁ
analyzed: no upādā dhammam paccayā upādā dhammo uppajjati na kamma paccayā bāhire āhāra samuṭṭhāne utu samuṭṭhāne mahābhūte paccayā upādā rūpa  no upādāḥ dhammam paccayā upādā ca no upādā ca dhammā uppajjanti na kamma paccayā bāhira
translated: With a non-clinging-aggregate as condition, a clinging-aggregate arises: with the external great primaries originating from nutriment, the great primaries originating from temperature, as condition, the clinging materiality.🔽With a non-clinging-aggregate as condition, a clinging-aggregate and a non-clinging-aggregate arise: with the external great primaries originating from nutriment, the great primaries originating from temperature, as condition, the three great primaries and the clinging materiality.

original: āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ utusamuṭṭhānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ paccayā tayo mahābhūtā upādā ca rūpaṁ
analyzed: āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam ekam mahābhūtam paccayā tayaḥ mahābhūtā upādā ca rūpa
translated: … With one great primary as condition, the three great primaries and the clinging materiality.

original: …pe… dve mahābhūte …pe….
analyzed: dve mahābhūte pe
translated: … With two great primaries …

original: Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati nakammapaccayā— noupādā khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā noupādā cetanā.
analyzed: upādā ca no upādā ca dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati na kamma paccayā no upādā khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā no upādā cetanā
translated: With attachment and without attachment as conditions, a phenomenon without attachment arises, a condition by way of kamma condition— without attachment mental factors and the physical basis as conditions, volition without attachment.

original: Navipākapaccayā pañca, naāhārapaccayā tīṇi, naindriyapaccayā tīṇi.
analyzed: na vipāka paccayā pañca na āhāra paccayā tīṇi na indriya paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-resultant as condition, five. With non-nutritive-essence as condition, three. With non-faculty as condition, three.

original: Najhānādi
analyzed: na jha an ādi
translated: Non-absorption, etc.

original: Upādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati najhānapaccayā—cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ.
analyzed: upādā dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammo uppajjati na jhāna paccayā cakkhu āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa
translated: With a phenomenon with attachment as condition, a phenomenon without attachment arises, a condition by way of non-absorption condition— the eye base as condition, eye-consciousness element … the body base as condition, body-consciousness element.

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati najhānapaccayā— pañcaviññāṇasahagataṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… bāhiraṁ āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: no upādā dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammo uppajjati na jhāna paccayā pañca viññāṇa sahagata  ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe bāhiram āhāra samuṭṭhāna
translated: With a phenomenon without attachment as condition, a phenomenon without attachment arises, a condition by way of non-absorption condition— the five consciousnesses accompanied by attachment …🔽one of the aggregates as condition, three aggregates … two of the aggregates … the external materiality that has arisen together with nutriment …

original: utusamuṭṭhānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ …pe… dve mahābhūte paccayā dve mahābhūtā.
analyzed: utu samuṭṭhānam asaññasattānam pe dve mahābhūte paccayā dve mahābhūtā

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā upādā dhammo uppajjati najhānapaccayā—bāhire āhārasamuṭṭhāne utusamuṭṭhāne asaññasattānaṁ mahābhūte paccayā upādā kaṭattārūpaṁ.
analyzed: no upādāḥ dhammam paccayā upādā dhammo uppajjati na jhāna paccayā bāhire āhāra samuṭṭhāne utu samuṭṭhāne asaññasattānam mahābhūte paccayā upādā kaṭattā rūpa
translated: With an object that is not clung to as condition, there arises what is clung to … (as in §1, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With an object that is not clung to as condition, there arises what is both clung to and not clung to … (as in §2, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is both clung to and not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §3, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ paccayā upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā uppajjanti najhānapaccayā— bāhiraṁ🔽āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ utusamuṭṭhānaṁ asaññasattānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ paccayā tayo mahābhūtā
analyzed: no upādāḥ dhammam paccayā upādā ca no upādā ca dhammā uppajjanti na jhāna paccayā bāhira  āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūtam paccayā tayaḥ mahābhūtā
translated: With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §4, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §5, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §6, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).

original: upādā ca kaṭattārūpaṁ …pe… dve …pe….
analyzed: upādā ca kaṭattā rūpam pe dve pe
translated: With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §7, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §8, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §9, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §10, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).🔽With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §11, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).

original: Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammaṁ paccayā noupādā dhammo uppajjati najhānapaccayā— cakkhuviññāṇasahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca cakkhāyatanañca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe….🔽Namaggapaccayā pañca, nasampayuttapaccayā tīṇi, navippayuttapaccayā tīṇi, nonatthipaccayā tīṇi, novigatapaccayā tīṇi.🔽2.10.13.3.2. Paccayapaccanīya🔽Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: upādā ca no upādā ca dhammam paccayā no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati na jhāna paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatam ekam khandhañca cakkha āyatanañca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe  na magga paccayā pañca na sampayutta paccayā tīṇi na vippayutta paccayā tīṇi no natthi paccayā tīṇi no vigata paccayā tīṇi  paccaya paccanīya  saṅkhyāvāra
translated: With what is not clung to as condition, there arises what is not clung to … (as in §12, but with the words “not clung to” instead of “not causally arisen”).

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: With what is not clung to

original: Nahetuyā pañca, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā pañca …pe… nakamme pañca, navipāke🔽pañca, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne pañca, namagge pañca, nasampayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na hetuyā pañca na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā pañca pe na kamme pañca na vipāke  pañca na āhāre tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne pañca na magge pañca na sampayutte tīṇi
translated: With respect to non-cause, there are five. With respect to non-object, there are three. With respect to non-predominance, there are five. … With respect to non-kamma, there are five. With respect to non-result, there are five.🔽With respect to non-nutriment, there are three. With respect to non-faculty, there are three. With respect to non-jhana, there are five. With respect to non-path, there are five. With respect to non-association, there are three.

original: navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With no cause as condition, there are five. With no object as condition, there are three. With no predominance as condition, there are five. With no kamma as condition, there are five. With no result as condition, there are five. With no nutriment as condition, there are three. With no faculty as condition, there are three. With no jhāna as condition, there are five. With no path as condition, there are five. With no association as condition, there are three. With no dissociation as condition, there are three. With no cessation as condition, there are three. With no disappearance as condition, there are three.

original: 2.10.13.4. Nissayavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāra
translated: .... The section on dependence

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.10.13.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api nissaya vāro api kātabbo  sa saṭṭhavāra
translated: The other two calculations and the section on dependence should be done in the same way.🔽.... The section on related

original: 2.10.13.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi🔽Noupādā dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho noupādā dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—noupādā ekaṁ khandhaṁ🔽saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi  no upādā dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā no upādā ekam khandha  sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe saṅkhitta
translated: .... The section on conditions in direct order, etc.🔽A related non-causally arisen dhammas arises with a non-causally arisen dhammas as its condition by way of condition being a cause: a single non-causally arisen mental-data aggregate related to three … two mental-data aggregates related to two mental-data aggregates … at the mind-element and the mind-consciousness element at the time of rebirth-linking … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ, adhipatiyā ekaṁ (sabbattha ekaṁ), avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyāḥ eka ārammaṇe eka adhipatiyāḥ ekam sabbattha eka avigate eka
translated: With a cause as condition, there is one. With an object as condition, there is one. With predominance as condition, there is one. (Everywhere one.) With no cause as condition, there is one. With no object as condition, there is one. With no predominance as condition, there is one. With no disappearance as condition, there is one.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: In direct order.

original: Noupādā dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho noupādā dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ noupādā
analyzed: no upādā dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam no upādā
translated: A related non-causally arisen dhammas arises with a non-causally arisen dhammas as its condition by way of condition being not a cause: a causally arisen materiality aggregate related to the three non-causally arisen mental aggregates …

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: When a single aggregate is associated with three aggregates … When two aggregates are associated with two aggregates … At the consciousness that is rebirth-linking in a becoming without thinking …

original: …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe saṁsaṭṭho vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: … when the aggregates associated with uncertainty and with agitation are associated with the perversion of view that is uncertainty and with the perversion of view that is agitation. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ.
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ eka na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte eka
translated: With no cause as condition: one. With no predominance: one. With no prior arising: one. With no subsequent arising: one. With no nutriment: one. With no faculty: one. With no jhāna: one. With no path: one. With no association: one.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.

original: 2.10.13.6. Sampayuttavāra🔽Itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.
analyzed: itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ

original: 2.10.13.7. Pañhāvāra🔽2.10.13.7.1. Paccayānuloma
analyzed: pañhāvāra  paccaya anuloma
translated: The two other ways of counting and the associated section should be done in the same way as above.

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Question Section🔽The Direct Order

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—noupādā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ no upādā hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam no upādā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: A causally-conditioned phenomenon is a condition, as cause condition, for a causally-conditioned phenomenon. The causally-conditioned causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the forms that originate with consciousness. At the time of rebirth-linking …

original: Noupādā dhammo upādā dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—noupādā hetū upādā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Noupādā dhammo upādā ca noupādā ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—noupādā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ upādā ca noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: no upādā dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ no upādā hetū upādā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  no upādā dhammaḥ upādā ca no upādā ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ no upādā hetū sampayuttakāna  khandhānam upādā ca no upādā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally conditioned phenomenon is related to a causally unconditioned phenomenon as a cause condition, a causally unconditioned cause is related to causally conditioned form that is mind-made as a cause condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …🔽A causally conditioned phenomenon is related to a causally conditioned phenomenon and a causally unconditioned phenomenon as a cause condition, a causally conditioned cause is related to the associated aggregates and to causally conditioned and causally unconditioned form that is mind-made as a cause condition.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Upādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—cakkhuṁ …pe… kāyaṁ … rūpe🔽…pe… rase vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati,
analyzed: ārammaṇa  upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe kāyam rūpe  pe rase vatthum aniccato pe domanassam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati
translated: Object

original: dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… rasāyatanaṁ
analyzed: dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe rasa āyatana
translated: A causally conditioned phenomenon is related to a causally unconditioned phenomenon as an object condition, the eye … the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … visible data … sounds … odors … tastes … tactile data are related to the corresponding kinds of consciousness as object conditions. The mind is related to mind-consciousness as object condition. Visible data … tactile data are related to the materiality of the kinds of consciousness that arise in the cognitive series as object condition. The visible data, etc., are related to the states of the cognitive series as object condition. The visible form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for eye-consciousness …🔽The flavour base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for tongue-consciousness …🔽The visible-form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for eye-consciousness …

original: …pe… rasāyatanaṁ jivhāviññāṇassa …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa🔽…pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu noupādā khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—phoṭṭhabbe
analyzed: pe rasa āyatanam jivhā viññāṇassa pe vatthu purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa  pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu no upādā khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayo  no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta phoṭṭhabbe
translated: The body base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for body-consciousness …🔽The prenascent states are a condition, as prenascence condition, for the resultant aggregates.🔽A state that is not a condition for the prenascent is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the postnascent. The visible-form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for eye-consciousness …🔽The sound base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for ear-consciousness …🔽The odour base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for nose-consciousness …

original: aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā noupādā dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,

translated: The flavour base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for tongue-consciousness …🔽The tangible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for body-consciousness.🔽The visible-form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with eye-consciousness.🔽The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with body-consciousness.🔽The visible-form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with eye-consciousness.🔽The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with body-consciousness.🔽The visible-form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with eye-consciousness.

original: vatthupurejātaṁ. Phoṭṭhabbāyatanañca kāyāyatanañca kāyaviññāṇassa purejātapaccayena
analyzed: vatthu purejāta phoṭṭhabba āyatanañca kāya āyatanañca kāya viññāṇassa purejāta paccayena
translated: The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with body-consciousness.

original: paccayo; phoṭṭhabbāyatanañca vatthu ca noupādā khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ phoṭṭhabba āyatanam ca vatthu ca no upādā khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The visible-form base is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the states associated with and co-nascent with eye-consciousness.🔽The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base is a

original: Pacchājātāsevana
analyzed: pacchā jāta āsevana
translated: Post-nascence condition means: post-nascent unprofitable factors are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for this pre-arisen unprofitable body. (The root should be asked about.)🔽Post-nascent unprofitable factors are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for this pre-arisen profitable body.

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo—pacchājātā noupādā khandhā🔽purejātassa imassa noupādā kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.)
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccaya upacchājātāḥ no upādāḥ khandhāḥ  purejātassa imassa noupādā kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam
translated: (The root should be asked about.) Post-nascent unprofitable factors are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for this pre-arisen unprofitable body and for this pre-arisen profitable body.

original: Pacchājātā noupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa upādā kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.🔽(Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.) Pacchājātā noupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa upādā kāyassa
analyzed: pacchājātā noupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa upādā kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo  mūlam pucchitabba pacchājātāḥ noupādā khandhāḥ purejātassa imassa upādā kāyassa
translated: Post-nascent profitable factors are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for this pre-arisen unprofitable body.🔽(The root should be asked about.) Post-nascent profitable factors are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for this pre-arisen profitable body.

original: ca noupādā kāyassa ca pacchājātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca no upādā kāyassa ca pacchājāta paccayena paccayo
translated: (The root should be asked about.) Post-nascent profitable factors are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for this pre-arisen unprofitable body and for this pre-arisen profitable body.

original: Āsevanapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.🔽Kamma🔽Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—noupādā
analyzed: āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ eka  kamma  no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā sahajātā no upādā
translated: Repetition condition means: … one …🔽Kamma condition means: An unprofitable factor is a condition, as kamma condition, for an unprofitable factor, either as conascence, or as prior, or as post-nascence. As conascence: An unprofitable volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena
analyzed: cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam no upādā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kamma paccayena
translated: As prior: An unprofitable volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness that arise later than it and are conascent with the last of the aggregates arisen through kamma-result.

original: paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—noupādā cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe cetanā vipākānam khandhānam
translated: At the time of rebirth-linking …

original: noupādā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: no upādā ca kaṭattā rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unformed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for the formed and unformed.🔽An unformed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for a formed element:🔽conascence, mutuality, support, association, kamma-result, nutriment, and presence.

original: Noupādā dhammo upādā dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—noupādā
analyzed: no upādā dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā sahajātā no upādā
translated: A formed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for an unformed element:🔽conascence, prenascence, postnascence, and presence.🔽A formed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for a formed element:

analyzed: cetanā upādā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: conascence, mutuality, support, dissociation, prenascence, postnascence, and presence.

original: …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—noupādā cetanā upādā kaṭattārūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe cetanā upādā kaṭattā rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayo
translated: An unformed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for an unformed element:🔽conascence, prenascence, postnascence, and presence.

original: Noupādā dhammo upādā ca noupādā ca dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ upādā ca no upādā ca dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā
translated: An unformed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for a formed element and an unformed element:

original: Sahajātā—noupādā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ upādā ca noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ
analyzed: sahajātā anoupādā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam upādā ca noupādā ca citta samuṭṭhānāna
translated: conascence, prenascence, postnascence, and presence.🔽A formed element is a condition, as kamma condition, for a formed element and an unformed element:

analyzed: rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe nānākkhaṇikā no upādā cetanā
translated: conascence, mutuality, support, dissociation, prenascence, postnascence, and presence.

original: vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ upādā ca noupādā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vipākānam khandhānam upādā ca no upādā ca kaṭattā rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The four great elementals are a condition, as post-nascence condition, for the materiality originated by kamma that has kamma as its condition and that has arisen.

original: Vipāka
analyzed: vipāka
translated: Result

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo—vipāko noupādā eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ …pe… dve khandhā …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… tīṇi.

translated: A resultant non-causative-process dhammā is a condition, as result condition, for a non-causative-process dhammā. Resultant one of the aggregates is a condition, as result condition, for three aggregates … two aggregates … at the mind-moment of rebirth-linking … three.

original: Āhāra🔽Upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo—kabaḷīkāro āhāro imassa upādā🔽kāyassa āhārapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ pucchitabbaṁ.) Kabaḷīkāro āhāro imassa noupādā

translated: As nutriment

translated: A causally-ineffective dhamma is a condition, as nutriment condition, for a causally-ineffective dhamma. Physical nutriment is a condition, as nutriment condition, for this causally-ineffective body. (The root should be asked for. ) Physical nutriment is a condition, as nutriment condition, for this causally-effective body. (The root should be asked for. ) Physical nutriment is a condition, as nutriment condition, for this causally-ineffective body and for this causally-effective body.

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo—noupādā āhārā sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ no upādāḥ āhārā sampayuttakāna
translated: A causally-ineffective dhamma is a condition, as nutriment condition, for a causally-ineffective dhamma. The causally-ineffective nutriments are a condition, as nutriment condition, for the associated …

original: khandhānaṁ noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ āhārapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: khandhānam no upādā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: The four nutriments are a condition, as faculty condition, for the kinds of materiality that are conascent with the mind and are derived from the four primary elements. At the moment of rebirth-linking

original: …pe…. (Noupādāmūlake tīṇi, paṭisandhikkhaṇe tīṇipi kātabbā.)
analyzed: tīṇi paṭisandhi khaṇe tīṇi pi kātabbā
translated: … (The three in the case of the unformed should be treated as in the case of the nutriments.)

original: Indriya🔽Upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo—rūpajīvitindriyaṁ upādā kaṭattārūpānaṁ🔽indriyapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Cakkhundriyaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyindriyaṁ
analyzed: indriya  upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayo rūpa jīvitindriyaṃ upādā  indriya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba cakkhu indriyam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya indriya
translated: Faculty🔽A formed object subject to cankers is a condition, as faculty condition, for a formed object subject to cankers,

original: kāyaviññāṇassa rūpajīvitindriyaṁ noupādā kaṭattārūpānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kāya viññāṇassa rūpa jīvita indriyam no upādā kaṭattā rūpānaṃ indriya paccayena paccayo
translated: The material life faculty is a condition, as faculty condition, for the kinds of materiality that are its associates. (The root should be treated in the same way as in the case of the nutriments.) The eye faculty is a condition, as faculty condition, for eye-consciousness and for the states associated therewith. The ear faculty … The nose faculty … The tongue faculty … The body faculty is a condition, as faculty condition, for body-consciousness and for the states associated therewith. The material life faculty is a condition, as faculty condition, for the kinds of materiality that are its associates.

original: (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Rūpajīvitindriyaṁ—upādā ca noupādā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mūlam rūpa jīvitindriya opādā ca noupādā ca indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: (The root should be treated in the same way as in the case of the nutriments.) The material life faculty is a condition, as faculty condition, for the kinds of materiality that are its associates and for the kinds of materiality that are not its associates.

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe
translated: An unformed object not subject to cankers is a condition, as faculty condition, for an unformed object not subject to cankers … three … at the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā noupādā dhammassa indriyapaccayena paccayo— cakkhundriyañca
analyzed: upādā ca no upādā ca dhammā no upādā dhammassa indriya paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhu indriyañca
translated: A formed object subject to cankers and an unformed object not subject to cankers are a condition, as faculty condition, for an unformed object not subject to cankers, and vice versa.

original: cakkhuviññāṇañca cakkhuviññāṇasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ indriyapaccayena paccayo …pe… kāyindriyañca …pe….
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇañca cakkhu viññāṇa sahagatānam khandhānam indriya paccayena paccayaḥ pe kāyindriyañca pe
translated: Eye-consciousness and the states associated with eye-consciousness are related to the faculties as faculty condition. … The body faculty …

original: Jhānādi
analyzed: jhāna ādi
translated: Jhana, etc.

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa jhānapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi, maggapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁ.
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi magga paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi paṭisandhi khaṇe pe sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ eka
translated: A state that is not a condition for grasping is related to a state that is not a condition for grasping as jhana condition … as path condition … At the moment of rebirth-linking … as association condition … as non-association condition.

original: Vippayutta🔽Upādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: vippayutta  upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta
translated: Non-associated🔽A state that is a condition for grasping is related to a state that is not a condition for grasping as non-association condition: as conascence, as prenascence.

original: Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu noupādā khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu no upādā khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As conascence: at the moment of rebirth-linking, the bases that are not a condition for grasping are related to the states that are not a condition for grasping as non-association condition.

original: Purejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthu noupādā khandhānaṁ🔽vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu no upādā khandhāna  vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As prenascence: the eye base is related to eye-consciousness … the body base … the mind base … the states that are not a condition for grasping as non-association condition.

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta
translated: A state that is not a condition for grasping is related to a state that is not a condition for grasping as non-association condition: as conascence, as postnascence.

original: Sahajātā—noupādā khandhā noupādā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: sahajātā no upādāḥ khandhāḥ no upādā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The postnascence condition means: postnascent states that are not clung to are a condition, as the disjoined condition, for prenascent materiality originated by mind.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe noupādā khandhā noupādā kaṭattārūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paṭisandhi kkhaṇe no upādāḥ khandhāḥ no upādā kaṭattā rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking, postnascent states that are not clung to are a condition, as the disjoined condition, for the materiality of the triple continuity that is not clung to.

original: Pacchājātā—noupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa noupādā kāyassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.🔽Noupādā dhammo upādā dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.
analyzed: pacchājātā noupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa noupādā kāyassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo  no upādā dhammaḥ upādā dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta
translated: The prenascence condition means: states that are not clung to are a condition, as the disjoined condition, for this body that is not clung to.🔽A state that is not clung to is a condition, as the disjoined condition, for a state that is clung to: conascence, postnascence.

original: Sahajātā—noupādā khandhā upādā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo;🔽paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Pacchājātā—noupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa upādā kāyassa
analyzed: sahajātā anoupādāḥ khandhāḥ upādā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ  paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe pacchājātā anoupādā khandhā purejātassa imassa upādā kāyassa
translated: The conascence condition means: the aggregates that are not clung to are a condition, as the disjoined condition, for the materiality originated by mind that is clung to.

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking … The postnascence condition means: postnascent states that are not clung to are a condition, as the disjoined condition, for this body that is clung to.

original: Noupādā dhammo upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,
analyzed: no upādā dhammassa ca no upādā dhammassa ca vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta
translated: A state that is not clung to is a condition, as the disjoined condition, for a state that is clung to and for a state that is not clung to: conascence,

original: pacchājātaṁ. Sahajātā—noupādā khandhā upādā ca noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: pacchājāta sahajātā anoupādā khandhāḥ upādā ca noupādā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ
translated: Postnascent …

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Pacchājātā—noupādā khandhā purejātassa
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe pacchājātā anoupādā khandhā purejātassa
translated: are related to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness that are both clung-to and not-clung-to as a condition by way of dissociation condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: imassa upādā kāyassa ca noupādā kāyassa ca vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: imassa upādā kāyassa ca noupādā kāyassa ca vippayutta paccayena paccayo
translated: are related to the kinds of materiality that are both clung-to and not-clung-to as a condition by way of dissociation condition.

original: Atthi🔽Upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Kabaḷīkāro🔽āhāro—imassa upādā kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Rūpajīvitindriyaṁ—upādā kaṭattārūpānaṁ
analyzed: atthi  upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo āhāra indriya kabaḷīkāro  upādā kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo rūpa jīvitindriya opādā
translated: There is 🔽A clung-to states is a condition for a clung-to states as a condition being, as nutriment, as a faculty.

original: atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Physical nutriment is a condition for this clung-to materiality as a condition being. The materiality of the life faculty is a condition for the kinds of materiality due to kamma performed as a condition being.

original: Upādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, āhāraṁ,
analyzed: upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta āhāra
translated: A clung-to states is a condition for a not-clung-to states as a condition being, as conascence, as prenascence, as nutriment, as a faculty.

original: indriyaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu noupādā khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: indriya sahajāta paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu no upādā khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As conascence: at the moment of rebirth-linking the physical basis is a condition for the not-clung-to aggregates as a condition being.

original: Purejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ aniccato …pe…. Kabaḷīkāro āhāro—imassa noupādā kāyassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: purejāta cakkhum aniccataḥ pe kabaḷīkāro āhāraḥ imassa no upādā kāyassa atthi paccayena

original: paccayo. Rūpajīvitindriyaṁ—noupādā kaṭattārūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.

original: Upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca atthipaccayena paccayo— āhāraṁ,🔽indriyaṁ. Kabaḷīkāro āhāro—imassa upādā kāyassa ca noupādā kāyassa ca atthipaccayena
analyzed: upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca atthi paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra  indriya kabaḷīkāro āhāro imassa upādā kāyassa ca noupādā kāyassa ca atthi paccayena
translated: An upadana idea is related to an upadana idea and to a non-upadana idea as support condition. Nutriment,🔽and a faculty. Physical nutriment is related to the upadana body and to the non-upadana body as support condition.

original: paccayo. Rūpajīvitindriyaṁ—upādā ca noupādā ca kaṭattārūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.🔽Sahajāto—noupādā eko khandho tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ noupādā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ

translated: The form that is post-nascence, nutriment, and faculty is a substantial cause for the kinds of form that are kamma-born, etc.

original: Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca atthipaccayena🔽paccayo—pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Pacchājātā—noupādā khandhā ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro🔽ca imassa upādā kāyassa ca noupādā kāyassa ca atthipaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—noupādā

translated: With-clinging and without-clinging are a substantial cause for clinging and for what is without-clinging.🔽Post-nascence: the kinds of form without clinging and the nutriment edible food are a substantial cause for the kinds of form with clinging and for the kinds of form without clinging.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Numbers

original: Suddha🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte🔽pañca, aññamaññe pañca, nissaye pañca, upanissaye dve, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: suddha  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā cattāri anantare eka samanantare eka sahajāte  pañca aññamaññe pañca nissaye pañca upanissaye dve purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: Pure

original: tīṇi, āsevane ekaṁ, kamme tīṇi, vipāke tīṇi, āhāre cha, indriye satta, jhāne tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane eka kamme tīṇi vipāke tīṇi āhāre cha indriye satta jhāne tīṇi
translated: In the section on the roots, there are three lines. In the section on object, there are two lines. In the section on predominance, there are four lines. In the section on proximity, there is one line. In the section on contiguity, there is one line. In the section on conascence, there are five lines. In the section on mutuality, there are five lines. In the section on support, there are five lines. In the section on decisive support, there are two lines. In the section on prenascence, there are three lines. In the section on postnascence, there are three lines. In the section on repetition, there is one line. In the section on kamma, there are three lines. In the section on kamma result, there are three lines. In the section on nutriment, there are six lines. In the section on faculty, there are seven lines. In the section on jhāna, there are three lines.

original: magge tīṇi, sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte cattāri, atthiyā nava, natthiyā ekaṁ, vigate ekaṁ, avigate nava.
analyzed: magge tīṇi sampayutte eka vippayutte cattāri atthiyā nava natthiyā eka vigate eka avigate nava
translated: there are three [roots] in the path, one in the associated, four in the not-associated, nine in the with-object, one in the without-object, one in the past, nine in the not-past.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: The direct order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra

original: Upādā dhammo upādā dhammassa āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: upādā dhammaḥ upādā dhammassa āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An object of clinging is a condition, as nutriment condition, for an object of clinging … as faculty condition.

analyzed: upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An object of clinging is a condition, as object condition, for a not object of clinging … as arising together condition …

analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as support condition … as pre-arising condition … as nutriment condition …

original: … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: indriya paccayena paccayaḥ

analyzed: upādā dhammaḥ upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An object of clinging is a condition, as nutriment condition, for an object of clinging and for a not object of clinging … as faculty condition.

original: Noupādā dhammo noupādā dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: no upādā dhammaḥ no upādā dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A not object of clinging is a condition, as object condition, for a not object of clinging … as arising together condition …

original: … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as support condition … as pre-arising condition … as post-arising condition …

original: … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … with kamma as condition.

original: Noupādā dhammo upādā dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Noupādā dhammo upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca sahajātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā upādā dhammassa pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.

translated: A non-clinging element is related to a clinging element as conascence condition, … as post-nascence condition, … as kamma condition.🔽A non-clinging element is related to a clinging element and a non-clinging element as conascence condition, … as post-nascence condition, … as kamma condition.🔽Clinging and non-clinging elements are related to a clinging element as post-nascence condition, … as nutriment condition, … as faculty condition.

original: Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā noupādā dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā noupādā dhammassa sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya
translated: Clinging and non-clinging elements are related to a non-clinging element as conascence condition, … as prenascence condition, … as post-nascence condition, … as nutriment condition, … as faculty condition.

original: Upādā ca noupādā ca dhammā upādā dhammassa ca noupādā dhammassa ca pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: upādā ca no upādā ca dhammā upādā dhammassa ca no upādā dhammassa ca pacchājātaḥ āhāra indriya
translated: Clinging and non-clinging elements are related to a clinging element and a non-clinging element as post-nascence condition, … as nutriment condition, … as faculty condition.

translated: With respect to non-cause, there are five. With respect to non-object, there are four. With respect to non-predominance, there are five. With respect to non-antecedent, there are four. With respect to non-conascence, there are four. With respect to non-concomitance, there are four. With respect to non-support, there are four. With respect to non-pre-nascence, there are four. With respect to non-post-nascence, there are five. With respect to non-kamma, there is one. With respect to non-result, there are two. With respect to non-nutriment, there are two. With respect to non-faculty, there are two. With respect to non-absorption, there are two. With respect to non-path, there are five. With respect to non-concomitance, there are four. With respect to non-deprivation, there are two. With respect to non-distance, there are four. With respect to non-obstruction, there are four.

original: 2.10.14.1.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri, naadhipatiyā pañca …pe… napurejāte cattāri, napacchājāte🔽pañca, naāsevane pañca, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ …pe… nasampayutte cattāri, navippayutte

translated: ..... The reverse order of conditions in forward order

original: dve, nonatthiyā cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: dve nonatthiyā cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: With respect to cause as condition, there are four with respect to non-object. With respect to non-predominance, there are five. With respect to non-pre-nascence, there are four. With respect to non-post-nascence, there are five. With respect to non-kamma, there is one. With respect to non-result, there is one. With respect to non-concomitance, there are four. With respect to non-deprivation, there are two. With respect to non-distance, there are four. With respect to non-obstruction, there are four.

original: 2.10.14.1.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: ..... The forward order of conditions in reverse order

translated: With non-cause as condition: in regard to object there are two; in regard to proximity there are two; in regard to contiguity there are two; in regard to kamma there are five; in regard to nutriment there are five; in regard to association there are two; in regard to presence there are five; in regard to non-disappearance there are five.

analyzed: vatthum paccayā khandhāḥ ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūte paccayā kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpa

… a wholesome immaterial path … a resultant immaterial path … a functional immaterial path … a fine-material resultant (form of consciousness) … a fine-material functional (form of consciousness) … an resultant thought-arisal … an immaterial functional thought-arisal … a fine-material resultant mind-element … a fine-material functional mind-element … an immaterial resultant mind-element … an immaterial functional mind-element … a fine-material resultant mind-consciousness-element … a fine-material functional mind-consciousness-element … an immaterial resultant mind-consciousness-element … an immaterial functional mind-consciousness-element … a fine-material resultant bodily formation … a fine-material functional bodily formation … an immaterial resultant bodily formation … an bodily intimation … a fine-material functional bodily intimation … an immaterial functional bodily intimation … a fine-material resultant sound … an immaterial resultant sound …

original: vatthuṁ paccayā upādinnā khandhā.🔽Upādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—upādinne khandhe paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā anupādinnā khandhā.
analyzed: vatthum paccayāḥ upādinnā khandhāḥ  upādinnam dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā aupādinne khandhe paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa vatthum paccayā anupādinnāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: With a clung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates are produced.🔽With a clung-to state as condition, an unclung-to state arises … with a clung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates and the materiality originated by the mind.🔽With a clung-to state as condition, a clung-to state and an unclung-to state arise … with a clung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates and the materiality originated by the mind.

original: Upādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā upādinno ca anupādinno ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—upādinnaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe….🔽Anupādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— anupādinnaṁ
analyzed: upādinnam dhammam paccayā upādinnaḥ ca anupādinnaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā aupādinnam ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe  anupādinnam dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anupādinna
translated: With an unclung-to state as condition, an unclung-to state arises … with an unclung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates and the materiality originated by the mind.🔽With an unclung-to state as condition, a clung-to state arises … with an unclung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates and the materiality originated by the mind.

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe…🔽ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… mahābhūte paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe  ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūte paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam
translated: With an unclung-to state as condition, a clung-to state and an unclung-to state arise … with an unclung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates and the materiality originated by the mind.

original: Upādinnañca anupādinnañca dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—upādinne
analyzed: upādinnam ca anupādinnam ca dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā aupādinne
translated: With a clung-to and an unclung-to state as condition, an unclung-to state arises … with a clung-to and an unclung-to state as condition, the other-recluses’ and other- brahmans’ aggregates and the materiality originated by the mind.

original: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ, anupādinnaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca
analyzed: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa anupādinnam ekam khandhañca
translated: The four great elementals and the form derived from the great elementals are a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of prenascent, postnascent, and co-nascent consciousness and the kinds of materiality associated therewith.

original: vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe….
analyzed: vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe
translated: The four great elementals and the form derived from the great elementals are a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of the three remaining aggregates and of the materiality that is not derived from the great elementals and is clung to.

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Upādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā upādinno dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—upādinnaṁ ekaṁ🔽khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… vatthuṁ
analyzed: ārammaṇa  upādinnam dhammam paccayā upādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā upādinnam eka  khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhā pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe vatthu
translated: As object condition🔽A form that is clung to is a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of three aggregates and of the materiality that is not derived from the primary elements and is clung to.

original: paccayā khandhā, cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ …pe… vatthuṁ🔽paccayā upādinnā khandhā.
analyzed: paccayā khandhā cakkha āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya āyatanam pe vatthu  paccayā upādinnā khandhā
translated: The eye base is a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of eye-consciousness and of the states associated therewith. The ear base … The nose base … The tongue base … The body base … The visible-data base … The sound base … The odour base … The flavour base … The tangible-data base … The mind base is a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of the three remaining aggregates.🔽A form that is clung to is a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of the three aggregates that are not clung to.

original: Upādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā anupādinnā khandhā.🔽Anupādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā— anupādinnaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe….
analyzed: upādinnam dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā vatthum paccayā anupādinnāḥ khandhāḥ 🔽anupādinnam dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā anupādinnam ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe
translated: A form that is not clung to is a condition, as a condition consisting of a condition being a condition of the three aggregates that are not clung to.

original: Upādinnañca anupādinnañca dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā—anupādinnaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe….
analyzed: upādinnam ca anupādinnañca dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā anupādinnam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca pe
translated: With a condition that is both depended on and not depended on, a condition that is not depended on arises, a condition by way of object condition—with one aggregate that is not depended on and the physical basis as condition, the three aggregates … with two aggregates …

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominant

original: Upādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā anupādinnā khandhā.🔽Anupādinnaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā— anupādinnaṁ
analyzed: upādinnam dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati adhipati paccayā vatthum paccayā anupādinnāḥ khandhāḥ  anupādinnam dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati adhipati paccayā anupādinna
translated: With a condition that is depended on, a condition that is not depended on arises, a condition by way of dominant condition—with the physical basis as condition, the aggregates that are not depended on.

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe…
analyzed: ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe
translated: With a condition that is not depended on, a condition that is not depended on arises, a condition by way of dominant condition—with one aggregate that is not depended on as condition, three aggregates and materiality originated by consciousness; with two aggregates …

original: ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe… mahābhūte paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: ekam mahābhūtam pe mahābhūte paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam
translated: with one of the great essentials … with the great essentials as condition, materiality derived from the great essentials and derived materiality.

original: Upādinnañca anupādinnañca dhammaṁ paccayā anupādinno dhammo uppajjati adhipatipaccayā—anupādinnaṁ
analyzed: upādinnam ca anupādinnam ca dhammam paccayā anupādinnaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati adhipati paccayā anupādinna
translated: With a condition that is both depended on and not depended on, a condition that is not depended on arises, a condition by way of dominant condition—with one of the great essentials as condition, the materiality that is not depended on and derived materiality.

original: ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe…. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca pe
translated: and with one aggregate and with a form object … and with two aggregates and with a form object … (Abbreviated.)

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on the number of conditions

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
